lines.value: बेल्जियम आधिकारिक रुपय् बेल्जियम राजतन्त्र छगू पश्चिमी युरोपय् अवस्थित संघीय राज्य ख। थ्व देय् युरोपियन युनियनया संस्थापक सदस्य ख। नापं थ्व देशय् इयुया मू ज्याकुथि व थीथी संघतयेगु मू ज्याकुथि नं दु दसु नेटो। बेल्जियम थीथी अन्तराष्ट्रिय संघतयेगु सदस्य नं ख गुकिलि acct afdb asdb अस्त्रेलिया ग्रुप बेनेलक्स bis ccc ce सर्न eapc ebrd eib emu esa eu fao g 10 iaea ibrd icao icc icrm ida idb iea ifad ifc ifrcs iho ilo imf imo imso intelsat इन्तरपोल ioc iom iso itu monuc observers नेटो nea nsg oas observer oecd opcw osce pca un unctad unece unesco unhcr unido unmik unmogip unrwa untso upu wadb non-regional weu who wipo wmo wtro zc आदि मू ख। बेल्जियमया कूल क्षेत्रफल दु व थ्व देय्‌या जनसंख्या करिब १ कोटी १०लख मनु दु। जर्मनिक-भासिक व लातिन युरोपया दथुइ लाःगु थ्व देसय् थ्व निगु हे मू भासिक प्रभाव खनेदु। थन दच भाषी फ्लेमिश करिब ६०% दु धाःसा फ्रेञ्चभाषी आपालं वालून करिब ४०% दु। नापं थन जर्मन भाषी मनुत नं दु। बेल्जियमया मू निगु भाग उत्तरया फ्लेमिश क्षेत्र व दक्षिणया वालूनिया ख। ब्रसेल्स क्षेत्र आधिकारिक कथं द्विभाषिय क्षेत्र ख। थ्व फ्लेमिश लागाया दुने लाःगु फ्रेञ्च भाषी भूभाग ख। छगू जर्मन भाषी पुचः पूर्वी वालूनियाय् अवस्थित दु। <ref name=german-speaking_community> the original version in german language already mentions 73000 instead of 71500 inhabitants

lines.value: थ्व छगु तत्त्व एलेमेन्ट ख। थ्व धातु मानक क्वाजः व चापय् झझखाइगु वहःथें-तुइसे च्वनिगु व भति-भति रियाक्टिभ जुइय। केमिकल रियाक्सनय् थ्व धातुं थःगु निगु भ्यालेन्स इलेक्ट्रोन अपुइक हे त्वता +2 चार्जया क्याटआयन जुइ। थ्व धातुया दकले पिनेया इलेक्ट्रोन एस अर्बाइटलय् लाःगु जुगुलिं थ्व धातु पिरियोडिक टेबलया s-ब्लकय् ला। थ्व धातु पृथ्वीइ प्राकृतिक रुपय् दु।

lines.value: बेनिन आधिकारिक रुपय् गणतन्त्र बेनिन छगू पश्चिम अफ्रिकी देय्‌ ख। थ्व देय्‌या पश्चिमय् टोगो पूर्वय् नाइजेरिया उत्तरय् बुर्किना फासो व नाइजर व दक्षिणय् bight of benin ला। थ्व देय्‌या क्षेत्रफल किमि २ दु धाःसा जनसंख्या ८,५०००,००० दु। थ्व देय्‌या राजधानी पोर्टो-नोभो जुसां सरकारी ज्याकुथि आपालं कोतोनोउइ ला।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: अम्ल मराठी ऍसिड यक्व थासय् जेनेरिक सूत्र कथं ha [h + a − ] सांस्कृतिक कथं रसायनिक कम्पाउण्ड ख। थ्व कम्पाउण्डयात लःया सम्पर्कय् तयेबिले छगू सोलुसन पिकई गुकिया हायड्रोजन आयन ऍक्टिव्हिटी शुद्ध लया स्वया अप्व जुइ वा ph ७.० स्वया म्हो जुइ। थ्व परिभाषा अम्लया आधुनिक परिभाषाया नापं ला। आधुनिक परिभाषाय् जोहानेस निकोलस ब्रोन्स्टेड व मार्टिन लौरीया परिभाषा दु इमिसं स्वतन्त्र कथं अम्लयात क्षारयात हायड्रोजन आयन h + ) बीइगु कम्पाउन्ड धका परिभाषित याना तःगु दु । साधारण दसुलि ऍसेटिक ऍसिड व्हिनेगरय् व सल्फ्युरिक अम्ल कार बॅटरीइ छ्य्‌लिगु आदि ला। अम्ल/क्षार व्यवस्था रिडक्स रिऍक्शन स्वया पा। अम्ल/क्षार व्यवस्थाय् रिडक्सय् थें ऑक्सिडेशन स्टेट पाइमखु।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: strong acids and many concentrated acids being corrosive can be dangerous causing severe burns for even minor contact
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: generally acid burns on the skin are treated by rinsing the affected area abundantly with running water followed up with immediate medical attention
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the case of highly concentrated mineral acids such as sulfuric acid or nitric acid the acid should first be wiped off otherwise the exothermic mixing of the acid and the water could cause thermal burns
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: particular acids may also be dangerous for reasons not related to their acidity
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: material safety data sheets msds can be consulted for detailed information on dangers and handling instructions
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: क्लासिकल नामाकरणय् अम्लतेत इमिगु एनायन कथं नां बियातै। that ionic suffix is dropped and replaced with a new suffix and sometimes prefix according to the table below
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example hcl has chloride as its anion so the ide suffix makes it take the form hydrochloric acid
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the iupac naming system aqueous is simply added to the name of the ionic compound
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: thus for hydrogen chloride the iupac name would be aqueous hydrogen chloride
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the prefix hydro- is added only if the acid is made up of just hydrogen and one other element
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in water the following equilibrium occurs between a weak acid ha and water which acts as a base ha(aq + h 2 o h 3 o + aq + a aq the acidity constant or acid dissociation constant is the equilibrium constant for the reaction of ha with water strong acids have large k a values i.e the reaction equilibrium lies far to the right the acid is almost completely dissociated to h 3 o + and a ).
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: strong acids include the heavier hydrohalic acids hydrochloric acid hcl hydrobromic acid hbr and hydroiodic acid hi
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: however hydrofluoric acid hf is relatively weak for example the k a value for hydrochloric acid hcl is 10 7 .weak acids have small k a values i.e at equilibrium significant amounts of ha and a − exist together in solution modest levels of h 3 o + are present the acid is only partially dissociated
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example the k a value for acetic acid is 1.8 x 10 -5
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: most organic acids are weak acids
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: oxoacids which tend to contain central atoms in high oxidation states surrounded by oxygen may be quite strong or weak
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: nitric acid sulfuric acid and perchloric acid are all strong acids whereas nitrous acid sulfurous acid and hypochlorous acid are all weak
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: note on terms used
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: मोनोप्रोटिक अम्ल थन्यागु अम्ल ख गुकिलिं केमिकल डिसोसियसन वा आयोनाइजेसन)य् छगू अम्ल प्रति मोलेक्युल दान यायेफु। दसु haया चिं दुगु अम्ल स्वयादिसँ :::::ha(aq) + h 2 o(l h 3 o + aq + a − aq k a थ्व कथंया अम्लया साधारण दसुलि खनिज अम्ल गुकिलि हाइड्रोक्लोरिक अम्ल hcl व नाइट्रिक अम्ल hno ३ ) ला ख। मेगु थासय् अर्‍ग्यानिक अम्लय् थ्व खँग्वः छगू कार्बोक्सिल पुचः दूगु अम्लया निंतिं छ्येलि गुकियात गबिलें-गबिलें मोनोकार्बोक्सिलिक अम्लया नां नं बिइगु या। दसुया अर्‍ग्यानिक अम्लय् फर्मिक अम्ल hcooh एसेटिक अम्ल ch ३ cooh व बेञ्जोइक अम्ल c ६ h ५ cooh ला।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: polyprotic acids are able to donate more than one proton per acid molecule in contrast to monoprotic acids that only donate one proton per molecule
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: specific types of polyprotic acids have more specific names such as diprotic acid two potential protons to donate and triprotic acid three potential protons to donate
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a diprotic acid here symbolized by h 2 a can undergo one or two dissociations depending on the ph
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: each dissociation has its own dissociation constant k a1 and k a2
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a triprotic acid h 3 a can undergo one two or three dissociations and has three dissociation constants where k a1 > k a2 > k a3
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: neutralization is the reaction between an acid and a base producing a salt and neutralized base for example hydrochloric acid and sodium hydroxide form sodium chloride and water ::hcl(aq) + naoh(aq → h 2 o(l + nacl(aq neutralization is the basis of titration where a ph indicator shows equivalence point when the equivalent number of moles of a base have been added to an acid
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is often wrongly assumed that neutralization should result in a solution with ph 7.0 which is only the case with similar acid and base strengths during a reaction
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: neutralization with a base weaker than the acid results in a weakly acidic salt
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: an example is the weakly acidic ammonium chloride which is produced from the strong acid hydrogen chloride and the weak base ammonia
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: conversely neutralizing a weak acid with a strong base gives a weakly basic salt e.g sodium fluoride from hydrogen fluoride and sodium hydroxide
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in order to lose a proton it is necessary that the ph of the system rise above the pk a of the protonated acid
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the decreased concentration of h + in that basic solution shifts the equilibrium towards the conjugate base form the deprotonated form of the acid
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in lower ph more acidic solutions there is a high enough h + concentration in the solution to cause the acid to remain in its protonated form or to protonate its conjugate base the deprotonated form
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: solutions of weak acids and salts of their conjugate bases form buffer solutions
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: अम्ल यक्व थासय् छ्य्‌लेछिं। अम्लयात आपालं खतं व मेमेगु धातुया करोजन corrosion लिकायेत पिक्लिङ प्रकृयाय् छ्येलि। अम्लयात वेट सेल ब्याट्रीइ इलेक्ट्रोलाइटया कथं नं छ्येलिगु या दसु स्ल्फ्युरिक अम्लयात कार ब्याट्रीइ छ्यलि। strong acids sulfuric acid in particular are widely used in mineral processing
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example phosphate minerals react with sulfuric acid to produce phosphoric acid for the production of phosphate fertilizers and zinc is produced by dissolving zinc oxide into sulfuric acid purifying the solution and electrowinning
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the chemical industry acids react in neutralization reactions to produce salts
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example nitric acid reacts with ammonia to produce ammonium nitrate a fertilizer
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: additionally carboxylic acids can be esterified with alcohols to produce esters
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: acids are used as catalysts for example sulfuric acid is used in very large quantities in the alkylation process to produce gasoline
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: strong acids such as sulfuric phosphoric and hydrochloric acids also effect dehydration and condensation reactions
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: acids are used as additives to drinks and foods as they alter their taste and serve as preservatives
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: phosphoric acid for example is a component of cola drinks
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: कस वा फ्लिन्त खनिज क्वार्टज्‌या छगू कडा सेडिमेन्टरी क्रिप्टोक्रिस्टलिन प्रकार ख। थुकियात chertया भेराइटीया रुपय् वर्गीकृत याना तःगु दु। थ्व प्राथमिक रुपय् सेदिमेन्तरी लोँह(दसु चक व लाइमस्तोन)य् नोद्युल व धीया रुपय् दयाच्वनि। थःगु धी दुने फ्लिन्त साधारनकथं गाढा ह्यंग्वा रंग हाकुगु वांगु तुयु वा सिं रंगय् खा वा मैन थें न्यागु रुपय् दयाच्वनि। थुकिया धीया पिनेया छगू सालुगु पत्रया रंग भतिचा पाइ व आपालं तुइसे व छागु जुइ। पेत्रोलोजीया विचाकथं flint refers specifically to the form of chert which occurs in chalk or marly limestone
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: similarly common chert sometimes referred to simply as chert occurs in limestone
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: फ्लिन्त गथे जुया दयावइ धाइगु खं आतक्क बांलाक्क मथुनि तर थ्व पदार्थ कम्प्रेस्द सेदिमेन्तरी लोँहय् दायाजेनेसिस प्रक्रिया बिलय् जूइगु रसायनिक परिवर्तनं दयावै धैगु विश्वास दु। one hypothesis is that a gelatinous material fills cavities in the sediment such as holes bored by crustaceans or molluscs and that this becomes silicified
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this theory certainly explains the complex shapes of flint nodules that are found
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the source of dissolved silica in the porous media could arise from the spicules of silicious sponges
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: when struck against steel flint will produce sparks which when directed onto tinder can be used to start a fire
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this occurs when the hard flint knocks off a particle of the steel which is heated by the impact and then burns with oxygen from the atmosphere
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this method is popular in woodcraft and among campers who want to have an authentic experience
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the components are also part of many survival kits such as those issued by many military units because they have the ability to work while wet have a very long shelf life and will last a very long time in an extended survival situation unlike matches or a lighter which not only need to be specially design to be able to light when wet but which would be exhausted sooner than a flint and steel fire starter in a longer duration survival scenario
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: striking a lump of flint against a piece of steel to make fire is not particularly easy or convenient although it is much easier than other primitive fire making methods such as using a bow and drill and requires little practice to employ
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: matches and lighters are a much quicker and more convenient way of starting a fire but have the disadvantages of being unable to function when wet except for special designs and of being more limited than flint and steel in the number of times that they can be used before exhausting their fuel supply
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: even so many lighters still use a variant of the ancient technology as the ignition source for their primary fuel due to the ease with which those materials generate a sufficiently hot spark
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: ferrocerium now replaces the steel and has been miniaturized and integrated into such lighters
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the ferrocerium used in these lighters while sometimes called flint has the opposite role than the flint in true flint and steel
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: ferrocerium is much softer than modern steel and can be scraped with knife with minimal damage to the knife
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in lighters a small steel wheel is turned by the user rotating it with the thumb creating a high temperature spark which ignites the lighters primary fuel source which is either present such as in liquid fuel lighters or which is also released by the same thumb motion such as in butane gas lighters which then produces a small flame that burns until extinguished
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: common examples include the disposable bic lighter and the reusable zippo lighter
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the small ferrocerium cylinder in zippo's spark producing mechanism is eventually consumed and zippo and other companies e.g ronson sell replacements that are marketed as flints even though they are ferrocerium
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: such mechanisms are more popular in liquid fuel lighters than in butane gas lighters which more commonly have a piezoelectric ignition system
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a later major use was to create the spark that would ignite the powder that would fire a ball or bullet from a flintlock firearm
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: while the military use of a flintlock declined after the british military generally applied the percussion cap on their muskets in 1842 it is still popular to use the flintlock as a hunting rifle during special muzzleloader seasons or general rifle seasons in several states in the us
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: flint knapped or unknapped has been used since antiquity for example at the late roman fort of burgh castle in norfolk up to the present day as a material for building stone walls using lime mortar and often combined with other available stone or brick rubble
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it was most common in parts of southern england where no good building stone was available locally and brick making not widespread until the later middle ages
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is especially associated with east anglia but also used in chalky areas stretching through sussex surrey and kent to somerset flint was used in the construction of many churches houses and other buildings for example the large stronghold of framlingham castle
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: many different decorative effects have been achieved by using different types of knapping or arrangement and combinations with stone flushwork especially in the 15th and early 16th centuries
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: flint pebbles are used as the media in ball mills to grind glazes and other raw materials for the ceramics industry
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the pebbles are hand selected for colour with those showing a reddish tint indicating the presence of iron being discarded
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the remaining blue grey stones have a low content of chromophoric oxides and so should impart lesser amounts of colouring contaminants
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the uk flint pebbles were traditionally an important raw material for clay based ceramic bodies
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: after calcination to remove organic impurities and induce certain physical reactions and milling to fine particle size flint was added as a filler to pottery bodies
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: however flint is no longer used and has been replaced by quartz as is used in other countries
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: because of this historical use the word flint is used by us potters to refer to siliceous materials which are not flint
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: ग्रान्द क्यानन होपि ongtupqa ) संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिकाया एरिजोना राज्यय् दूगु छगू पाःलूगु गल्छि ख। थ्व गल्छि कोलोरादो खुसिं चाना दयेकूगु ख। थ्व गल्छि ग्रान्द क्यानन राष्ट्रिय पार्कय् ला। थ्व थाय् हुआलापाइ जाति त्राइबल नेसनं व हाभासुपाइ जातितयेसं रेखदेख या। थ्व क्षेत्र संरक्षणया निंतिं अमेरिकाया न्हापाम्ह राष्ट्रपति थियोदोर रुजवेल्तं यक्व कुतः यानादिल। थुकियात हलिंया ७गु प्राकृतिक आश्चर्यय् छगूया रुपय् नं कायेगु या।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the license wikipedia uses grants free access to our content in the same sense as free software is licensed freely
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this principle is known as copyleft
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: that is to say wikipedia content can be copied modified and redistributed so long as the new version grants the same freedoms to others and acknowledges the authors of the wikipedia article used a direct link back to the article satisfies our author credit requirement
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: wikipedia articles therefore will remain free forever and can be used by anybody subject to certain restrictions most of which serve to ensure that freedom
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: to fulfill the above goals the text contained in wikipedia is licensed to the public under the gnu free documentation license gfdl
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the full text of this license is at
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: <font size="+1">important if you want to use content from wikipedia first read the section
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: you should then read the
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if you want to use wikipedia materials in your own books/articles/web sites or other publications you can do so but you have to follow the gfdl
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if you are simply duplicating the wikipedia article you must follow of the gfdl on verbatim copying as discussed at
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if you create a derivative version by changing or adding content this entails the following
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: an example notice for an article that uses the wikipedia article metasyntactic variable might read as follows : this article is licensed under the <a href="http://wwwgnuorg/copyleft/fdlhtml">gnu free documentation license
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it uses material from the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/metasyntactic_variable">wikipedia article metasyntactic variable"
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: metasyntactic variable and the wikipedia url must of course be substituted accordingly alternatively you can distribute your copy of metasyntactic variable along with a copy of the gfdl as explained in the text and list at least five or all if fewer than five principal authors on the title page or top of the document
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the external page history stats tool can help you identify the principal authors
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: all original wikipedia text is distributed under the gfdl
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: occasionally wikipedia articles may include images sounds or text quotes used under the us copyright law "" doctrine
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is preferred that these be obtained under the most free libre license such as the gfdl or public domain practical
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in cases where no such images sounds are currently available then fair use images are acceptable until such time as free images become available
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in wikipedia such fair use material should be identified as from an external source on the image description page or history page as appropriate
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this also leads to possible restrictions on the use outside of wikipedia of such fair use content retrieved from wikipedia this fair use content does not fall under the gfdl license as such but under the fair use or similar different regulations in the country where the media are retrieved
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: wikipedia does use some text under licenses that are compatible with the gfdl but may require additional terms that we do not require for original wikipedia text such as including invariant sections front cover texts or back cover texts
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: when wanting to contribute such texts that include invariant sections or cover texts to wikipedia see introducing invariant sections or cover texts in wikipedia below
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: images and photographs like written works are subject to copyright
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: someone owns them unless they have been explicitly placed in the
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: images on the internet need to be licensed directly from the copyright holder or someone able to license on their behalf
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in some cases fair use guidelines may allow a photograph to be used
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: image description pages can be tagged with a special tag to indicate the legal status of the images as described at
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is currently unclear what should happen in cases where the same image has been uploaded more than once with different respective copyright statements
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: works produced by civilian and military employees of the united states federal government in the scope of their employment are public domain by statute
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: however note that despite popular misconception the us federal government can own copyrights that are assigned to it by others for example works created by contractors
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: be careful however not all images on .mil and .gov websites are public domain
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: among other reasons the site may be using commercial stock photography owned by others
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it may be useful to check the privacy and security notice of the website but only with an email to the webmaster can you be confident that an image is in the public domain
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it should also be noted that governments outside the us often do claim copyright over works produced by their employees for example crown copyright in the united kingdom
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: also most state and local governments in the united states do not place their work into the public domain and do in fact own the copyright to their work
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: please be careful to check ownership information before copying
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the uk office of public sector information formerly hmso has told us : crown copyright protection in published material lasts for fifty years from the end of the year in which the material was first published
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: therefore [for example] material published [fifty-one years ago] and any crown copyright material published before that date would now be out of copyright and may be freely reproduced throughout the world
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this is based on the image guidelines at imdb so it especially applies to celebrity photographs but also can apply to other pictures
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: legitimate photographs generally come from three different places with permission
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: according to the russian copyright law of 1993 ( фeaepanbhыn зakoh ot 9.07.1993 № 5351-1 the following items are not subject to copyrights if an item was not published during author's life its copyright expire in 70 years after its first lawful publication if the item wasn't moved into pd before
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this gives maximum term for unpublished or posthumously published works of 140 if the author died after 1953 or 120 years if the author died before 1953 and his work was published before 2003
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if an item was published anonymously or pseudonymously and its author remains unknown its copyright expires in 70 years after its first lawful publication
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if the author is discovered usual rule applies
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: pd status of a work in russia can differ with that in the us where wikipedia servers are located
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: article 9 of algeria's ordonnance n°97-10 du 27 chaoual 1417 correspondant au 6 mars 1997 relative aux droits d'auteur et aux droits voisins
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: states that works of the state made licitly accessible to the public may be freely used for non profit purposes subject to respect for the integrity of the work and indication of its source
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by works of the state in this article are meant works produced and published by the various organs of the state local communities or public establishments of an administrative character original is in french in short they are available for non commercial use which is deprecated on wikipedia
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: although there has been no treaty between iran and the united states regarding copyright protection according to jimbo wales wikipedia contributors should respect iranian copyright law as best they can the same as they do for other countries around the world
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if you contribute material to wikipedia you thereby license it to the public under the gfdl with no invariant sections front cover texts or back cover texts
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in order to contribute you therefore must be in a position to grant this license which means that either in the second case if you incorporate external gfdl materials as a requirement of the gfdl you need to acknowledge the authorship and provide a link back to the network location of the original copy
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: under wikipedia's current copyright conditions and with the current facilities of the mediawiki software it is only possible to include in wikipedia external gfdl materials that contain invariant sections or cover texts if all of the following apply
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if you use part of a copyrighted work under "", or if you obtain special permission to use a copyrighted work from the copyright holder under the terms of our license you must make a note of that fact along with names and dates
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is our goal to be able to freely redistribute as much of wikipedia's material as possible so original images and sound files licensed under the gfdl or in the public domain are greatly preferred to copyrighted media files used under fair use
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: see for a form letter asking a copyright holder to grant us a license to use their work under terms of the gfdl
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: never use materials that infringe the copyrights of others
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this could create legal liabilities and seriously hurt the project
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if in doubt write it yourself
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: note that copyright law governs the creative expression of ideas not the ideas or information themselves
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: therefore it is legal to read an encyclopedia article or other work reformulate the concepts in your own words and submit it to wikipedia
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: however it would still be unethical but not illegal to do so without citing the original as a reference
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: see plagiarism and fair use for discussions of how much reformulation is necessary in a general context
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: linking to copyrighted works is usually not a problem as long as you have made a reasonable effort to determine that the page in question is not violating someone else's copyright
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if it is please do not link to the page
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: whether such a link is contributory infringement is currently being debated in the courts but in any case linking to a site that illegally distributes someone else's work sheds a bad light on us
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if the site in question is making fair use of the material linking is ok
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is not the job of rank and file wikipedians to police content for possible copyright infringement but if you suspect one you should at the very least bring up the issue on that page's talk page
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: others can then examine the situation and take action if needed
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the most helpful piece of information you can provide is a url or other reference to what you believe may be the source of the text
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: some cases will be false alarms
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example if the contributor was in fact the author of the text that is published elsewhere under different terms that does not affect their right to post it here under the gfdl
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: also sometimes you will find text elsewhere on the web that was copied from wikipedia
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in both of these cases it is a good idea to make a note in the talk page to discourage such false alarms in the future
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if some of the content of a page really is an infringement then the infringing content should be removed and a note to that effect should be made on the talk page along with the original source
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if the author's permission is obtained later the text can be restored
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if all of the content of a page is a suspected copyright infringement then the page should be listed on and the content of the page replaced by the standard notice which you can find there
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if after a week the page still appears to be a copyright infringement then it may be deleted following the procedures on the votes page
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in extreme cases of contributors continuing to post copyrighted material after appropriate warnings such users may be blocked from editing to protect the project
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: विलियम होगार्थ november 10 1697 &ndash october 261764 was a major english painter printmaker pictorial satirist social critic and editorial cartoonist who has been credited with pioneering western sequential art
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: his work ranged from excellent realistic portraiture to comic strip like series of pictures called modern moral subjects
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: much of his work though at times vicious poked fun at contemporary politics and customs
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: illustrations in such style are often referred to as hogarthian
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the son of a poor school teacher and textbook writer william hogarth was born at bartholomew close in london on november 10 1697
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in his youth he was apprenticed to the engraver ellis gamble in leicester fields where he learned to engrave trade cards and similar products
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: young william also took a lively interest in the street life of the metropolis and the london fairs and amused himself by sketching the characters he saw
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: around the same time his father who had opened an unsuccessful latin speaking coffee house at st john's gate was imprisoned for debt in fleet prison for five years
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth never talked about the fact
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by april 1720 he was an engraver in his own right at first engraving coats of arms shop bills and designing plates for booksellers
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1727 he was hired by joshua morris a tapestry worker to prepare a design for the element of earth
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: morris however heard that he was an engraver and no painter and consequently declined the work when completed
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth accordingly sued him for the money in the westminster court where the case was decided in his favour on may 28 1728
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: on march 23 1729 he was married to jane thornhill daughter of artist sir james thornhill
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1757 he was appointed serjeant painter to the king
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth died in london on october 26 1764 and was buried at st nicholas's churchyard chiswick mall chiswick london
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: his friend the actor david garrick wrote the inscription on his tombstone
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: early satirical works included an emblematical print on the south sea scheme c.1721 about the disastrous stock market crash of 1720 known as the south sea bubble in which many english people lost a great deal of money
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the bottom left corner he shows protestant catholic and jewish figures gambling while in the middle there is a huge machine like a merry go round which people are boarding
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: at the top is a goat written below which is who'l ride and this shows the stupidity of people in following the crowd in buying stock in the south sea company which spent more time issuing stock than anything else
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the people are scattered around the picture with a real sense of disorder which represented the confusion
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the progress of the well dressed people towards the ride in the middle shows how foolish some people could be which is not entirely their own fault
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: other early works include the lottery 1724 the mystery of masonry brought to light by the gormogons 1724 a just view of the british stage 1724 some book illustrations and the small print masquerades and operas 1724
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the latter is a satire on contemporary follies such as the masquerades of the swiss impresario john james heidegger the popular italian s john rich's pantomimes at lincoln's inn fields and last not least the exaggerated popularity of lord burlington's protege the architect and painter william kent
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he continued that theme in 1727 with the large masquerade ticket
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1726 hogarth prepared twelve large engravings for samuel butler's hudibras
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these he himself valued highly and are among his best book illustrations
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the following years he turned his attention to the production of small conversation pieces i.e groups in oil of full length portraits from 12 to 15 in
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: high
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: among his efforts in oil between 1728 and 1732 were the fountaine family c.1730 the assembly at wanstead house the house of commons examining bambridge and several pictures of the chief actors in john gay's popular the beggar's opera
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: one of his masterpieces of this period is the depiction of an amateur performance of john dryden's the indian emperor or the conquest of mexico 1732–1735 at the home of john conduitt master of the mint in st george's street hanover square
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth's other works in the 1730s include a midnight modern conversation 1733 southwark fair 1733 the sleeping congregation 1736 before and after 1736 scholars at a lecture 1736 the company of undertakers consultation of quacks 1736 the distrest poet 1736 the four times of the day 1738 and strolling actresses dressing in a barn 1738
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he may also have printed burlington gate 1731 evoked by alexander pope's epistle to lord burlington and defending lord chandos who is therein satirized
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this print gave great offence and was suppressed some modern authorities however no longer attribute this to hogarth
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1731 he completed the earliest of the series of moral works which first gave him recognition as a great and original genius
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this was a harlot's progress first as paintings now lost and then published as engravings
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in its six scenes the miserable fate of a country girl who began a prostitution career in town is traced out remorselessly from its starting point the meeting of a bawd to its shameful and degraded end the whore's death of venereal disease and the following merciless funeral ceremony
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the series was an immediate success and was followed in 1735 by the sequel a rake's progress showing in eight pictures the reckless life of tom rakewell the son of a rich merchant who wastes all his money on luxurious living whoring and gambling and ultimately finishes his life in bedlam
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the original paintings of a harlot's progress were destroyed in the fire at fonthill abbey in 1755 a rake's progress is displayed in the gallery room at sir john soane's museum london
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1743–1745 hogarth painted the six pictures of marriage a-la-mode national gallery london a pointed skewering of upper class 18th century society
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this moralistic warning shows the miserable tragedy of an ill considered marriage for money
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this is regarded by many as his finest project certainly the best example of his serially planned story cycles
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: marital ethics were the topic of much debate in 18th century britain
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: frequent marriages of convenience and their attendant unhappiness came in for particular criticism with a variety of authors taking the view that love was a much sounder basis for marriage
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth here painted a satire - a genre that by definition has a moral point to convey - of a conventional marriage within the english upper class
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: all the paintings were engraved and the series achieved wide circulation in print form
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the series which are set in a classical interior shows the story of the fashionable marriage of the son of bankrupt earl squanderfield to the daughter of a wealthy but miserly city merchant starting with the signing of a marriage contract at the earl's mansion and ending with the murder of the son by his wife's lover and the suicide of the daughter after her lover is hanged at tyburn for murdering her husband
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the twelve prints of industry and idleness 1747 hogarth shows the progression in the lives of two apprentices one who is dedicated and hard working the other idle which leads to crime and his execution
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this shows the work ethic of protestant england where those who work hard get rewarded such as the industrious apprentice who becomes sheriff plate 8 alderman plate 10 and finally the lord mayor of london in the last plate in the series
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the idle apprentice who begins with being at play in the church yard plate 3 holes up in a garrett with a common prostitute after turning highwayman plate 7 and executed at tyburn plate 11
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the idle apprentice is sent to the gallows by the industrious apprentice himself
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: later important prints include his pictorial warning of the unpleasant consequences of alcoholism in beer street and gin lane 1751 hogarth engraved beer street to show a happy city drinking the good beverage of english beer versus gin lane which showed the effects of drinking gin which as a harder liquor caused more problems for society
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: people are shown as healthy happy and prosperous in beer street while in gin lane they are scrawny lazy and careless
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the woman at the front of gin lane who lets her baby fall to its death echoes the tale of judith dufour who strangled her baby so she could sell its clothes for gin money
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the prints were published in support of what would become the gin act 1751
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth's friend the magistrate henry fielding may have enlisted hogarth to help with propaganda for a gin act beer street and gin lane were issued shortly after his work an enquiry into the causes of the late increase of robbers and related writings and addressed the same issues
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: other prints were his outcry against inhumanity in the four stages of cruelty 1751 a series which hogarth intended to show some of the terrible habits of criminals
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the first picture there are scenes of torture of dogs cats and other animals
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the second it shows one of the characters from the first painting tom nero has now become a coach driver and his cruelty to his horse caused it to break its leg
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the third painting tom is shown as a murderer with the woman he killed lying on the ground while in the fourth titled reward of cruelty the murderer is shown being dissected by scientists after his execution
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth is thus using the series to say what will happen to people who carry on in this manner
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this shows what crimes people were concerned with in this time the method of execution and the dissection reflects upon the 1752 act of parliament which had just being passed allowing for the dissection of executed criminals who had been convicted for murder
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it shows his reaction against the cruel treatment of animals which he saw around him that he wished could be stopped
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth was also a popular portrait painter
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1746 he painted actor david garrick as richard iii for which he was paid £200 which was more he wrote than any english artist ever received for a single portrait in the same year a sketch of simon fraser 11th lord lovat afterwards beheaded on tower hill had an exceptional success
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth's truthful vivid full length portrait of his friend the philanthropic captain coram 1740 formerly thomas coram foundation for children now foundling museum and his unfinished oil sketch of the shrimp girl national gallery london may be called masterpieces of british painting
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: during a long period of his life hogarth tried to achieve the status of history painter but had no great success in this field
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: examples of his history pictures are the pool of bethesda and the good samaritan executed in 1736–1737 for st bartholomew's hospital moses brought before pharaoh's daughter painted for the foundling hospital 1747 formerly at the thomas coram foundation for children now in the foundling museum paul before felix 1748 at lincoln's inn and his altarpiece for st mary redcliffe bristol 1756
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the gate of calais 1748 now in tate britain was produced soon after his return from a visit to france
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: horace walpole wrote that hogarth had run a great risk to go there since the peace of aix la chapelle he went to france and was so imprudent as to be taking a sketch of the drawbridge at calais
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he was seized and carried to the governor where he was forced to prove his vocation by producing several caricatures of the french particularly a scene of the shore with an immense piece of beef landing for the lion d'argent the english inn at calais and several hungry friars following it
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: they were much diverted with his drawings and dismissed him
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: back home he immediately executed a painting of the subject in which he unkindly represented his enemies the frenchmen as cringing emaciated and superstitious people while an enormous sirloin of beef arrives destined for the english inn as a symbol of british prosperity and superiority
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he claimed to have painted himself into the picture in the corner with the solder running him in
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: notable hogarth engravings in the 1740s includethe enraged musician 1741 the six prints of marriage a-la-mode 1745 executed by french artists under hogarth's inspection and the stage coach or the country inn yard 1747
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1745 hogarth painted a self portrait with his pug dog now also in tate britain which shows him as a learned artist supported by volumes of shakespeare milton and swift
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1749 he represented the somewhat disorderly english troops on their march of the guards to finchley formerly thomas coram foundation for children now foundling museum
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: others were his ingenious satire on false perspective 1753 his satire on canvassing in his election series 1755–1758 now in sir john soane's museum his ridicule of the english passion for cockfighting in the cockpit 1759 his attack on methodism in credulity superstition and fanaticism 1762 his political anti war satire in the times plate i 1762 and his pessimistic view of all things in tailpiece or the bathos 1764
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth also wrote and published his ideas of artistic design in his book the analysis of beauty 1753
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in it he professes to define the principles of beauty and grace which he a real child of rococo saw realized in serpentine lines the line of beauty
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth lived in an age when artwork became increasingly commercialized and viewed in shop windows taverns and public buildings and sold in printshops
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: old hierarchies broke down and new forms began to flourish the ballad opera the bourgeois tragedy and especially a new form of fiction called the novel with which authors such as henry fielding had great success
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: therefore by that time hogarth hit on a new idea painting and engraving modern moral subjects to treat my subjects as a dramatic writer my picture was my stage as he himself remarked in his manuscript notes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he drew from the highly moralizing protestant tradition of dutch genre painting and the very vigorous satirical traditions of the english broadsheet and other types of popular print
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in england the fine arts had little comedy in them before hogarth
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: his prints were expensive and remained so until early nineteenth century reprints brought them to a wider audience
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: when analyzing the work of the artist as a whole ronald paulson the modern authority on hogarth sees an accomplished parodist at work and a subversive
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he says in a harlot's progress every single plate but one is based on durer's images of the story of the virgin and the story of the passion in other works he parodies leonardo da vinci's last supper
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: according to paulson hogarth is subverting the religious establishment and the orthodox belief in an immanent god who intervenes in the lives of people and produces miracles
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: indeed hogarth was a deist a believer in a god who created the universe but takes no direct hand in the lives of his creations
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: thus as a comic history painter he often poked fun at the old fashioned beaten subjects of religious art in his paintings and prints
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth also rejected lord shaftesbury's then current ideal of the classical greek male in favor of the living breathing female
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he said who but a bigot even to the antiques will say that he has not seen faces and necks hands and arms in living women that even the grecian venus doth but coarsely imitate
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: his satirical engravings are often considered an important ancestor of the comic strip
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth's work were a direct influence on john collier who was known as the lancashire hogarth
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth's paintings and prints have provided the subject matter for several other works
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example igor stravinsky's opera the rake's progress with libretto by w h auden was inspired by hogarth's series of paintings of that title
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: russell banks's short story indisposed is a fictional account of hogarth's infidelity as told from the viewpoint of his long suffering wife jane
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hogarth's house in chiswick west london is now a museum free entry it abuts one of london's best known road junctions &ndash the hogarth roundabout
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: प्लेटो व सोक्रेटिज नापं वय्‌कःयात पाश्चात्य दर्शनया दक्ले महत्त्वपूर्ण आदि विचारकया कथं हनिगु या। पाश्चात्य दर्शनयात व्यवस्थित रुपय् यंकिम्ह दक्ले न्हापांया मनु वय्‌क हे ख। aristotle's views on the physical sciences profoundly shaped medieval scholarship and their influence extended well into the renaissance although they were ultimately replaced by modern physics

lines.value: all aspects of aristotle's philosophy continue to be the object of active academic study today
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: though aristotle wrote many elegant treatises and dialogues cicero described his literary style as a river of gold it is thought that the majority of his writings are now lost and only about one third of the original works have survived
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the ulna is broader proximally and narrower distally
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: proximally the ulna has a bony process the olecranon process a hook like structure that fits into the olecranon fossa of the humerus
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this prevents hyperextension and forms a hinge joint with the trochlea of the humerus
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: there is also a radial notch for the head of the radius and the ulnar tuberosity to which muscles can attach
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: distally near the hand there is a styloid process
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the long narrow medullary cavity is enclosed in a strong wall of compact tissue which is thickest along the interosseous border and dorsal surface
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: at the extremities the compact layer thins
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the compact layer is continued onto the back of the olecranon as a plate of close spongy bone with lamella parallel
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: from the inner surface of this plate and the compact layer below it trabecula arch forward toward the olecranon and coronoid and cross other trabecula passing backward over the medullary cavity from the upper part of the shaft below the coronoid
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: below the coronoid process there is a small area of compact bone from which trabecula curve upward to end obliquely to the surface of the semilunar notch which is coated with a thin layer of compact bone
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the trabecula at the lower end have a more longitudinal direction
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: since the first european contact was made in 1513 by spanish explorer juan ponce de leon - who named it la florida flowery land upon landing there during the easter season pascua florida - florida was a challenge for the european colonial powers before it gained statehood in the united states in 1845
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it was a principal location of the seminole wars against the indians and racial segregation after the american civil war
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: today it is distinguished by its large hispanic community and high population growth as well as its raising environmental concerns
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: its economy relies mainly on tourism agriculture and transport which developed in the late 19th century
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: florida is also known for its amusement parks the production of oranges and the kennedy space center
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: florida culture is a reflection of influences and multiple inheritance native american european american african american and hispanic heritages can be found in the architecture and cuisine
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: florida has attracted many writers such as marjorie kinnan rawlings ernest hemingway and tennessee williams and continues to attract celebrities and athletes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is internationally known for tennis golf auto racing and water sports
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: वर्ल्ड हेल्थ अर्गेनाइजेसन who हलिमय् उसाँय्‌या समन्वय यायेगु अभिभारा कयाच्वंगु संयुक्त राष्ट्र संघया छगू विशेष एजेन्सी ख। अप्रिल ७ १९४८य् पलिस्था जूगु थ्व गुथिया मू-थाय्‌बाय्‌ जेनेभा स्विजरल्याण्डय् दु। थ्व संस्थां लीग अफ नेसनस्‌य् पलिस्था जूगु द हेल्थ अर्गेनाइजेसनया स्रोत व जिम्मेवारी कया ज्या न्ह्यथंगु ख।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: थ्व संस्थाया विधान कथं थ्व संस्थाया उद्देश्य is the attainment by all peoples of the highest possible level of health सकल मनुतेसं दक्ले च्वेया दर्जाया उसाँय् कायेफैगु ख। थ्व गुथिया मू ज्या ल्वेनाप ल्वाइगु विशेषयाना मू संक्रमक ल्वे व हलिमया मनुतेत साधारण उसाँय्‌या बारेय् प्रचार यायेगु ख। वर्ल्ड हेल्थ अर्गेनाइजेसन संयुक्त राष्ट्र संघया उत्त्पत्तिकाल निसें दयाच्वंगु संस्थाय् छगू ख। प्रथम हलिम उसाँय् दिवस अप्रिल ७ १९४८)य् संयुक्त राष्ट्र संघया २६गु सदस्य राष्ट्रतेसं थ्व संस्थायात मान्यता बी धुंका थ्व संस्थाया विधान आधिकारिक कथं न्ह्यथन । थ्व जुइ स्वया न्ह्यः थ्व संस्थाया ज्या व लीग अफ नेसन्‌स्‌ हेल्थ अर्गेनाइजेसनया ल्यं दनिगु ज्या सन् १९४६इया वर्खाय् च्वंगु अन्तराष्ट्रिय उसाँय् कन्फरेन्सं देकूगु इन्टेरिम कमिसन interim commission)या अधीनय जुयाच्वन । इन्टेरिम कमिसनया ज्या थ्व संस्थायात लल्हाइगु ज्यायात संयुक्त राष्ट्र संघ जेनेरल एसेम्ब्लीया छगू रेजोलुसनं वैधानिकता बिल । फ्रेञ्च office international d'hygiene publique'या इपिडेमियोलोजिकल सेवायात इन्टेरिम कमिसन अफ द वर्ल्ड हेल्थ अर्गेनाइजेसनय् धाःसा ज्यानुवरी १ १८४७य् सम्मिलित यात ।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: who मू-ज्याकुथि जेनेभाय् सन् २००७ फेब्रुवरीइ जूगु विज्ञतेगु सहलह ज्याझ्वले विज्ञतेसं प्यान्डेमिक इन्फ्लुएन्जा खोप विकासय् उत्साहजनक सफलता जूगु कार्यपत्र क्यनेज्या जुल। थ्व ख्यले ४० स्वया अप्व क्लिनिकल ट्रायलत जुयाच्वंगु वा सिधेधुंकल। आपालं विज्ञतेसं म्हफुम्ह वस्यकतेत फोकस याःगु दु। छुं कम्पनीतेसं वस्यकय् सेफ्टी एनालाइसिस यायेधुंका एल्डर्ली व मचाय् नं क्लिनिकल ट्रायल न्ह्यथंगु दु। सकल खोप आःतक्क सुरक्षित व सकल एज ग्रुपय् बांलाक्क tolerated जूगु खने दु। who नं सोधज्या नं या। दसु सेल फोनया इलेक्ट्रोम्याग्नेटिक फिल्डया उसाँय् प्रतिकारात्मक असरया सोधज्या। थन्यागु छुं ज्या विवादित नं जुइफु दसु अप्रिल २००३इ संयुक्त who/fao कार्यपत्रय् उसाँय्‌ दूगु आहारय् चिनीया मात्रा १०% स्वया अप्व जुइ मज्युगु खं प्रकाशित जुल। थ्व रिपोर्टया विरोधय् चिनी उद्योगतेसं लबी यात थुकिया लिसले who/fao नं रिपोर्टय् the consultation recognized that a population goal for free sugars ofless than 10% of total energy is controversial कन्सल्टेसनं स्यु कि जनताय् फ्रि चिनी सकल इनर्जीया १०% स्वया म्हो जुइगु लक्ष्य विवादित जु वक्तव्य तनिगु ज्या यात तर थःगु वैज्ञानिक मालेज्यां लुयावःगु सुझावयात धाःसा मत्वतल।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: ६०औं वर्ल्ड हेल्थ असेम्ब्लीया सहकार्यय् who नं छगू global plan of action on workers health ड्राफ्ट यागु दु। थुकिलिं ज्याकुथिइ उसाँय्‌ संरक्षण व सम्बर्धन यायेगु अकुपेसनल उसाँय् सेवातेगु ज्या बाँलाकिगु व थुकिया access अप्वगिकु व ज्यायाइपिनिगु उसाँय्‌यात मेमेगु नियम अन्तरगत नं लाकिगु कुतः याःगु दु। whoनं थ्व कुतःयात जोड बीमागु कारण अकुपेसनल हजार्ड पनेत ज्याबीगु इन्टरभेन्सनत दुसां ज्यायाइपिनिगु उसाँय् अवस्था व इमिगु अकुपेसनल रिस्कय् एक्स्पोजरय् देय्‌दुने व देय्‌दथुइ व्यवस्थाय् तःधंगु खाडल दु गुकिलिं थ्व व्यवस्थायात बांलाक्क ज्यायायेत थाकुयाच्वंगु दु। who कथं हलिमया वर्कफोर्सय् छगू चिधंगु खण्डं जक्क अकुपेसनल हेल्थ सर्भिस उपभोग यायेखंगु दु। थ्व एक्सन प्लानं ज्यायाइपिनिगु उसाँय्‌या थीथी पक्षनाप स्वापो तइ गुकिलि अकुपेसनल हजार्डया प्राथमिक पनेज्या ज्यायाइगु थासय् उसाँय्‌या संरक्षण व प्रवर्धन जागीरया शर्त व उसाँय् व्यवस्थां ज्यायाइपिनिगु अवस्थाया बांलागु रेस्पोन्स ला।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: whoया धाःगु मिसन नापं अन्तराष्ट्रिय सन्धितेगु यक्व जिम्मेवारी नं थ्व संस्थाइके दु। दसु single convention on narcotic drugs व convention on psychotropic substances कथं who नं साइकोएक्टिभ वासःया वैज्ञानिक व चिकित्सा अभमूल्यनयात स्वायेगु व थन्याःगु वासःतेगु नियमिकरण यायेमा। अतः who नं राष्ट्रिय वासः नियम-निर्माणय् नं निरिक्षकया ज्या याइ। who नं international classification of diseases icd)यात नं पालना याइ। icdया १०गु संस्करण वा icd 10 सन् १९९२इ प्रकाशित जुल व थुकिया मालेछिंगु संस्करण who वेबथासय् दु। लिपाया संस्करण इन्डेक्स्ड दु व हार्ड-कपि संस्करणय् दु। who नं थ्व कथं छगू चीजया निगु थासय् छकलं हे निगु वर्गीकरण याये मबीगु प्रावधान दु। who नं इसेन्सियल वासःया छगू नमुना धलः नं संकलित याइ। थ्व वास सकल देय्‌या उसाँय्‌ व्यवस्था ख्यलं साधारण जनयातेत उपलब्ध व न्यायेफैगु यायेमा।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: who member states appoint delegations to the world health assembly who's supreme decision making body

lines.value: all un member states are eligible for who membership and according to the who web site other countries may be admitted as members when their application has been approved by a simple majority vote of the world health assembly the who has 193 member states
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the who assembly generally meets in may each year
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in addition to appointing the director general every five years the assembly considers the financial policies of the organization and reviews and approves the proposed programme budget
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the assembly elects 34 members technically qualified in the field of health to the executive board for three year terms
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the main functions of the board are to carry out the decisions and policies of the assembly to advise it and to facilitate its work in general
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: whoय् १९३ सदस्य राष्ट्र दु गुकिलि लिक्टेन्स्टाइन बाहेक सकल युएन सदस्य राष्ट्र व २ गैह्र-un सदस्य niue व कूक टापू ला। युएन सदस्य मजूगु भूभागतेसं असोसियट सदस्यया कथं एसेम्ब्ली भोट धुंका सदस्यता कायेछिं। थथे सदस्यता कायेबिले सदस्यतेसं पूर्ण जानकारी तर निश्चित थासय् जक्क भाग कायेगु व मत बीगु अधिकार दै। प्युएर्तो रिको व तोकेलाउ आःया ईले असोसियट मेम्बर दु। छुं संस्थातेत अब्जर्भर स्टेटस नं बीगु या दसु प्यालेस्टाइन लिबरेसन अर्गेनाइजेसन व होली सी भेटिकन सिटी)।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: whoया अर्थ थुकिया सदस्य देय्‌ व दानकःमितेगु पाखें वइ। आःया ईले वया whoया ज्या आपालं कोल्याबरेसनय् जुइ who नं आ थ्यं-मथ्यं ८०गु थन्याःगु पार्टनरशिपय् गैह्र-सरकारी संस्थात व वासः उद्योगनाप ज्या यानाच्वँगु दु नापं बिल एण्ड मेलिन्दा गेट्स फाउन्डेसन व रकःफेलः फाउन्डेसनया ग्वहालिइ नं ज्या यानाच्वंगु दु। whoया निंतिं स्वयंसेवक स्तरय् राष्ट्रिय व स्थानीय सरकार फाउण्डेसन व ngo मेमेगु un संस्था निजी क्षेत्र आदिया योगदान १९३ देशं वइगु आर्थिक योगदान स्वया अप्वःगु दु।

lines.value: [[image:world health organisation regional offices.svg|thumb|क्षेत्रीय ज्याकुथि व whoया क्षेत्र:uncharacteristically for a un agency the six regional offices of the who enjoy remarkable autonomy
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: each regional office is headed by a regional director rd who is elected by the regional committee for a once renewable five year term
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the name of the rd elect is transmitted to the who executive board in geneva which proceeds to confirm the appointment
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is rare that an elected regional director is not confirmed.each regional committee of the who consists of all the health department heads in all the governments of the countries that constitute the region
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: aside from electing the regional director the regional committee is also in charge of setting the guidelines for the implementation within the region of the health and other policies adopted by the world health assembly
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the regional committee also serves as a progress review board for the actions of the who within the region.the regional director is effectively the head of the who for his or her region
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the rd manages and or supervises a staff of health and other experts at the regional headquarters and in specialized centers
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the rd is also the direct supervising authority - concomitantly with the who director general - of all the heads of who country offices known as who representatives within the region
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the regional offices are
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the world health organization operates 147 country and liaison offices in all its regions
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the presence of a country office is generally motivated by a need stated by the member country
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: there will generally be one who country office in the capital occasionally accompanied by satellite offices in the provinces or sub regions of the country in question
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the country office is headed by a who representative wr who is a trained physician not a national of that country who holds diplomatic rank and is due privileges and immunities similar to those of an ambassador extraordinary and plenipotentiary
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in most countries the wr like representatives of other un agencies is de facto and or de jure treated like an ambassador the distinction here being that instead of being an ambassador of one sovereign country to another the wr is a senior un civil servant who serves as the ambassador of the who to the country to which he or she is accredited
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hence the title of resident representative or simply representative
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the country office consists of the wr and several health and other experts both foreign and local as well as the necessary support staff
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the main functions of who country offices include being the primary adviser of that country's government in matters of health and pharmaceutical policies
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: international liaison offices serve largely the same purpose as country offices but generally on a smaller scale
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these are often found in countries that want who presence and cooperation but do not have the major health system flaws that require the presence of a full blown country office
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: liaison offices are headed by a liaison officer who is a national from that particular country without diplomatic immunity
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: each year the report combines an expert assessment of global health including statistics relating to all countries with a focus on a specific subject

lines.value: ओदेसि वा ओडेसी प्राचीन ग्रीसया छगू महाकाव्य ख। थ्व महाकाव्य चिनाखँमि होमरं च्वयादीगु धैगु विश्वास दु। नापं होमरं मेगु महाकाव्य इलियाद नं च्वयादीगु धैगु विश्वास दु। थ्व महाकाव्य माइसिनियन ग्रीसया मौखिक परम्पराय् आधारित पद्य कृति ख। थ्व पद्य परम्परा करिब ११गू शदी इपू निसें न्ह्यथंगु धैगु विश्वास दु। थ्व महाकाव्यया मू नायः ओदिसियस odysseus ख। वय्‌कःयात लातिनभासय् युलिसेस ulysses धका नं म्हसीकिगु या। थ्व छगू साहित्यिक ग्रन्थ ख व थुकिया ऐतिहासिकया पुष्टि मजुनि। थ्व तःधं-चिनाखँया मू बाखँ त्रोजन हताः धुंकाः ओदिसियस्‌ थःगु छें इथेका ithaca लिहांवैगु समुद्र मार्गया यात्रा ख। त्रोजन हताःया बाखँ धाःसा इलियाद महाकाव्यय् कनातःगु दु। ओदिसियस् लिहां वयाच्वंबिलय् वय्‌कःया छेँय् वय्‌कःया कलाः पेनेलोपे(penelope)नाप इहिपा यायेत वयाच्वंगु मिजंत नाप पेनेलोपेया संघर्ष इमिगु काय् तेलेमाचोस् telemachos)या थः अबुया मालेज्याया बाखँ नं थ्व महाकाव्यय् दुथ्यानातःगु दु।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: हाइड्रोजन पिरियोडिक टेबलया न्हापांगु रसायनिक तत्त्व ख। थुकिया रसायनिक चिं h ख।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: नुगः छगू मिनेतय् १००कः तक्क मिनिगु या। प्रति मिनेत सच्छि स्वया अप्व मिनिगु नुगःया अवस्थायात त्याकिकार्दिया धाइ। नुगः मिनिगु ल्याया मनूया आयुनाप नं स्वापू दु। ल्याम्ह बलय् नुगः प्राकृतिक रुपं हे बुराबिलय् स्वया याकनं मिनिगु या। नुगःया गति नुगलय् दयाच्वंगु साइनस नोद sinus node धाःगु थासं निर्धारित याइ। म्ह तच्वलं संकिबिलय् दसु व्यायाम याइबिलय् नुगःया साइनस नोदं थःगु वैद्युतीय ज्या तच्वयेकी। थ्व कथं छुं कारणवश नुगःया गति तःच्वैगु अवस्थायात साइनस त्याकिकार्दिया(sinus tachycardia धाइ। अरिदमिया धाःगु अवस्थाय् असाधारण रुपय् नुगः तःच्वलं मिनेफु व थ्व अवस्था प्राणघातक जुइफु। if the ventricles of the heart experience one of these tachycardias for a long period of time there can be deleterious effects
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: individuals may sense a tachycardia as a pounding sensation of the heart known as palpitations
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if a tachycardia lowers blood pressure it may cause lightheadedness or dizziness or even fainting syncope
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if the tachycardia is too fast the pump function of the heart is impeded which may lead to a sudden death
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: most tachycardias are not dangerous
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: anything that increases adrenaline or its effects on the heart will increase the heart rate and potentially cause palpitations or tachycardias
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: causes include stress ingested or injected substances ie caffeine alcoholsee holiday heart syndrome and an overactive thyroid gland हाइपरथाइरोइडिजम
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: individuals who have a tachycardia are often advised to limit or remove exposure to any causative agent
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: स्लो रिदम वा ब्र्याडिकार्डिया ६० बीट प्रति मिनेट स्वया म्हो अप्व याना ज्यान पाइगु जुइमखु तर थुकिलिं सिम्प्टमतः क्येने फु। when it causes symptoms implantation of a permanent pacemaker may be needed
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: either dysrhythmia requires medical attention to evaluate the risks associated with the arrhythmia
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a serious variety of arrhythmia is known as fibrillation
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the muscle cells of the heart normally function together creating a single contraction when stimulated
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: fibrillation occurs when the heart muscle begins a quivering motion due to a disunity in contractile cell function
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: fibrillation can affect the atrium atrial fibrillation or the ventricle ventricular fibrillation ventricular fibrillation is imminently life threatening
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: एट्रियल फिब्रिलेसन छगु quivering chaotic motion in the upper chambers of the heart known as the एट्रिया
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: atrial fibrillation is often due to serious underlying medical conditions and should be evaluated by a physician
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is not typically a medical emergency
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: ventricular fibrillation occurs in the ventricles lower chambers of the heart it is always a medical emergency
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: if left untreated ventricular fibrillation vf or v fib can lead to death within minutes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: when a heart goes into v fib effective pumping of the blood stops
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: v fib is considered a form of cardiac arrest and an individual suffering from it will not survive unless cardiopulmonary resuscitation cpr and defibrillation are provided immediately
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: cpr can prolong the survival of the brain in the lack of a normal pulse but defibrillation is the intervention which is most likely to restore a more healthy heart rhythm
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it does this by applying an electric shock to the heart after which sometimes the heart will revert to a rhythm that can once again pump blood
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: almost every person goes into ventricular fibrillation in the last few minutes of life as the heart muscle reacts to diminished oxygen or general blood flow trauma irritants or depression of electrical impulses themselves from the brain
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: when an electrical impulse begins in any part of the heart it will spread throughout the myocardium and cause a contraction see electrical conduction system of the heart
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: abnormal impulses can begin by one of two mechanisms automaticity or reentry
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: automaticity refers to a cardiac muscle cell firing off an impulse on its own
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: every cardiac cell has this potential if it does not receive any impulses from elsewhere its internal pacemaker will fire off an impulse after a certain amount of time
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a single specialized location in the atrium the sinoatrial node has a higher automaticity a faster pacemaker than the rest of the heart and therefore is usually the one to start the heartbeat
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: any part of the heart that initiates an impulse without waiting for the sinoatrial node is called an ectopic focus and is by definition a pathological phenomenon
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this may cause a single premature beat now and then or if the ectopic focus fires more often than the sinoatrial node it can produce a sustained abnormal rhythm
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: rhythms produced by an ectopic focus in the atria or by the atrioventricular node are the least dangerous dysrhythmias but they can still produce a decrease in the heart's pumping efficiency because the signal reaches the various parts of the heart muscle with slightly different timing than usual and causes a poorly coordinated contraction
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: conditions that increase automaticity include sympathetic nervous system stimulation and hypoxia
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the resulting heart rhythm depends on where the first signal begins if it is the sinoatrial node the rhythm remains normal but rapid if it is an ectopic focus many types of dysrhythmia can result
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: re entrant dysrhythmias occur when an electrical impulse travels in a circle within the heart rather than moving outward and then stopping
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: every cardiac cell is able to transmit impulses in every direction but will only do so once within a short period of time
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: normally the impulse spreads through the heart quickly enough that each cell will only respond once but if conduction is abnormally slow in some areas part of the impulse will arrive late and will be treated as a new impulse which can then spread backward
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: depending on the timing this can produce a sustained abnormal rhythm such as atrial flutter a self limiting burst of supraventricular tachycardia or the dangerous ventricular tachycardia
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by analogy imagine a room full of people all given these instructions if you see anyone starting to stand up then stand up for three seconds and sit back down if the people are quick enough to respond the first person to stand will trigger a single wave which will then die out but if there are stragglers on one side of the room people who have already sat down will see them and start a second wave and so on
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: cardiac dysrhythmias are often first detected by simple but nonspecific means auscultation of the heartbeat with a stethoscope or feeling for peripheral pulses
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these cannot usually diagnose specific dysrhythmias but can give a general indication of the heart rate and whether it is regular or irregular
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: not all the electrical impulses of the heart produce audible or palpable beats in many cardiac arrhythmias the premature or abnormal beats do not produce an effective pumping action and are experienced as skipped beats
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the simplest specific diagnostic test for assessment of heart rhythm is the electrocardiogram abbreviated ecg or ekg
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a holter monitor is an ecg recorded over a 24-hour period to detect dysrhythmias that may happen briefly and unpredictably throughout the day
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: sads or sudden arrhythmia death syndrome is a term used to describe sudden death due to cardiac arrest brought on by an arrhythmia
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the most common cause of sudden death in the us is coronary artery disease
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: approximately 300000 people die suddenly of this cause every year in the us
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: sads can also occur from other causes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: also there are many inherited conditions and heart diseases that can affect young people that can cause sudden death
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: many of these victims have no symptoms before dying suddenly
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: causes of sads in young people are long qt syndrome brugada syndrome catecholaminergic polymorphic ventricular tachycardia and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia arrythmia"-causing right ventricle involving pre cancerous malformation(bad-growth
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: there are many classes of antiarrhythmic medications and many individual drugs within these classes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: see the article on antiarrhythmic agents
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: dysrhythmias may also be treated electrically
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: cardioversion is the application of electrical current across the chest wall to the heart and it is used for treatment of supraventricular or pulsed ventricular tachycardia
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: defibrillation differs in that it is used for ventricular fibrillation and pulseless ventricular tachycardia and more electricity is delivered with defibrillation than with cardioversion
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in cardioversion the recipient is either sedated or lightly anesthetized for the procedure
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in defibrillation the recipient has lost consciousness so there is no need for sedation
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: electrical treatment of dysrhythmia includes cardiac pacing
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: temporay pacing may be done for very slow heartbeats or bradycardia from drug overdose or myocardial infarction
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a pacemaker may be placed in situations where the bradycardia is not expected to recover
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: atrial fibrillation can also be treated through a procedure e.g pulmonary vein isolation
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this is performed by a cardiologist who specializes in electrophysiology and is done percutaneously with catheters
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: alternatively a maze procedure can be performed through cardiothoracic surgery
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: transvenous catheter ablation is established as a curative treatment for many arrhythmias
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: using image integration guided catheter ablation it is possible to know the precise location of the catheter in relation to the cardiac anatomy
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the cartomerge tm mapping system from biosense webster integrates pre procedural computed tomography ct or magnetic resonance mr images with electroanatomic maps has recently been approved for patient care
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: fatty acids play an important role in the life and death of cardiac cells because they are essential fuels for mechanical and electrical activities of the heart
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: सर आर्थर इग्नेटियस कोनान डोइल डेपुटी ल्युटिनेन्ट २२ मे १८५९ - ७ जुलाइ १९३० छम्ह बेलायती च्वमि ख। वय्‌कःया दक्ले नांजाःगु बाखँमुना जासुस शर्लक होम्स गुकियात अपराध फिक्सनय् छगू तःधंगु इनोभेसनया कथं कायेगु या व प्रोफेसर च्यालेञ्जरया एड्भेञ्चर ख। वय्‌कः छम्ह prolific च्वमि ख। वय्‌कःया मेमेगु च्वसुलि विज्ञान फिक्सन बाखँ ऐतिहासिक उपन्यास नाटक व रोमान्स चिनाखँ व सत्यकथा आदि ला।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: एलेन मातिसन त्युरिङ्ग alan mathison turing obe frs जुन २३ सन् १९१२-जुन ७ सन् १९५४ छम्ह बेलायती गणितज्ञ तर्कविद् क्रिप्त्‌एनालिस्त कम्प्युतर साइन्तिस्त व दार्शनिक ख। वय्‌कया कम्प्युटर विज्ञानया विकासय् तःधंगु ल्हा दु। वय्‌कलः अल्गोरिदम व कम्प्युतेसनया आधारिक रुप त्युरिङ्ग मेशिनय् बियादिल। थ्व मेशिनयात दकलय् न्हापांगु साधारण ज्या कम्प्युटरया रुपय् कायेगु या। त्युरिङ्गयात यक्व विज्ञतेसं सैद्धान्तिक कम्प्युतर विज्ञान व आर्तिफिसियल इन्तेलिजेन्सया अबुया रुपय् नालेगु या।

lines.value: daimler and maybach founded daimler motoren gesellschaft daimler motor company dmg in cannstatt in 1890 and under the brand name daimler sold their first automobile in 1892 which was a horse drawn stagecoach built by another manufacturer that they retrofitted with an engine of their design

lines.value: the first design for an american automobile with a gasoline internal combustion engine was drawn in 1877 by george selden of rochester new york who applied for a patent for an automobile in 1879 but the patent application expired because the vehicle was never built and proved to work a requirement for a patent

lines.value: after a delay of sixteen years and a series of attachments to his application on november 5 1895 selden was granted a united states patent () for a two stroke automobile engine which hindered more than encouraged development of automobiles in the united states

lines.value: his patent was challenged by henry ford and others and overturned in 1911

lines.value: in britain there had been several attempts to build steam cars with varying degrees of success with thomas rickett even attempting a production run in 1860

lines.value: santler from malvern is recognized by the veteran car club of great britain as having made the first petrol powered car in the country in 1894 followed by frederick william lanchester in 1895 but these were both one offs

lines.value: the first production vehicles in great britain came from the daimler motor company a company founded by harry j lawson in 1896 after purchasing the right to use the name of the engines

lines.value: in 1892 german engineer rudolf diesel was granted a patent for a new rational combustion engine
