lines.value: सर्ग अन्वेषण space exploration सर्गया भौतिक अन्वेषण खः। थन्यागु अन्वेषण ह्युमन सर्गयान वा रोबोटिक सर्गयान या रुपय् जुइ। सर्गया वस्तुतेत स्वैगु व विश्लेषण याइगु विज्ञान खगोलशास्त्र च्वयातगु इतिहास स्वया नं पुलांगु जुसां २०औं शताब्दीय् वया तधंगु तरल-इन्धनयुक्त रकेट इन्जिनया देकेज्या धुंका तिनि सर्ग अन्वेषण वास्तविक रुपे सम्भव जुल। सर्ग अन्वेषणया साधारण उद्देश्य वैज्ञानिक मालेज्या अन्तरराष्ट्रिय एकता व मनुजातिया भविष्यया सुनिश्चितता आदि खः।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: अबू अब्दल्लाह मुहम्मद इब्न मूसा अल-ख़्वारिज़्मी ( अरबी अंग्रेजी muḥammad ibn musa al khwarizmi ; बुगु करिब ७८० ई मदूगु करिब ८५० ई पाश्चात्य देशय् गलतीं अल्गोरित्मी ( algoritmi ) व अलगौरिज़िन​ ( algaurizin ) नं धाइगु या छम्ह इरानी-मूलया गणितज्ञ खगोलशास्त्री व भूगोलविद् ख। वय्‌कः व ईया नांजाःगु बग़दाद​या विस्डम हाउस बुद्धिगृह नाप स्वापू दूम्ह मनु ख। वय्‌कःया १२गु शताब्दीया भारतीय ल्याखँया छुं कृतित लातिन भाषाय् भाय्‌हिला जुया भारतीय ल्या व दशमलव प्रणाली पाश्चात्य हलिंइ थ्यन। वय्‌कःयात युरोपय् बीजगणित अल्जेब्रा)या जन्मदाता धका नालेगु यासां लिपा लुयावःगु तथ्य कथं वय्‌कःया च्वखँ वास्तवय् प्राचीन भारतीय व यवन स्रोतं वःगु खनेदु। वय्‌कलं टोलेमीया भौगोलिक कृतियात विस्तृत याना अरबीइ भाय्‌हिला छ्वयादिल। अंग्रेजीया कम्प्यूटर-स्वागु अल्गोरिदम ( algorithm ) खँग्वः वय्‌कःया हे नामं वःगु खँग्वः ख। थ्व कथं हे वय्‌कलं थःगु गणितया सफूलि आपालं अल-जब्र ( ) खँग्वः च्वइगु यानादिल गुकिया अर्थ पूर्व अवस्थाय् यंकिगु वा बहाल यायेगु ख। थ्व अपभ्रंश जुया अल्जेब्रा ( algebra ) जुवन गुकिया अंग्रेजीइ अर्थ बीजगणित ख।

lines.value: सर विलियम वालेस(१२७० - २३ अगस्त १३०५ छम्ह स्कटिस नाइट ख| वेकलं स्कटिसयात अंग्रेजतेगु विरुद्धयागु स्वतन्त्रता संग्रामले नेतृत्व बिया दिल| william was the inspiration for the historical novel the acts and deeds of sir william wallace knight of elderslie written by the 15th century minstrel blind harry
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this work is more of a novel than a biography and is responsible for much of the legend encompassing the history of william wallace
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: tradition often describes wallace as one of the common people in contrast to his countryman robert the bruce who came from the upper nobility
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: wallace's family were minor nobles gentry descending from richard wallace the welshman the name wallace means welsh a landowner under an early member of the house of stuart which later became the royal house of scotland
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: while some suggest wallace was born around 1272 the 16th century work history of william wallace and scottish affairs claims 1276 as his year of birth
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: due to the lack of conclusive evidence wallace's birthdate and birthplace are disputed
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: traditionally the birthplace of william wallace is claimed to be elderslie near paisley in renfrewshire although it has been suggested that his birthplace was closer to ellerslie an alternative name for riccarton near hurlford and kilmarnock in ayrshire
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in support of the ellerslie origins some proposed that william's traditional father alan wallace of elderslie was known as malcolm wallace until recently when they rediscovered william wallace's seal a knight and vassal to james the steward actually came from riccarton ayrshire from nearby loudoun
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: there are also strong family connections to craigie castle southeast of kilmarnock
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: some of wallace's earliest actions were in ayrshire and local tradition has the dispute with english soldiers over fish not in lanark but west of riccarton at a site known as the bickering bush
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: to the contrary the elderslie origins are defended with the arguments that ellerslie is a former mining village known only from the 19th century whereas elderslie is known from earlier
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: wallace's first action was at lanark which is near neither elderslie nor ellerslie and afterward he moved into ayrshire to join some scottish nobles who were fighting the english at irvine
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the 1999 rediscovery of william wallace's seal further enshrouds wallace's early history in mystery
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: while tradition claims sir malcolm wallace of elderslie as the father of three sons malcolm john and william wallace the seal identifies william as the son of alan wallace of ayrshire who appears in the ragman roll of 1296 as crown tenant of ayrshire
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: dr fiona watson in a report into sir william wallace's connections with ayrshire published in march 1999 reassesses the early life of william wallace and concludes sir william wallace was a younger son of alan wallace a crown tenant in ayrshire
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: historian andrew fisher author of william wallace 2002 writes if the alan of the ragman roll was indeed the patriot's father then the current argument in favour of an ayrshire rather than a renfrewshire origin for wallace can be settled
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: wallace was allegedly educated in french and latin by two uncles who had become priests
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: blind harry does not mention wallace's departure from scotland or that wallace had combat experience prior to 1297
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a record from august 1296 references a thief one william le waleys in perth where his cousin william crawford owned a farm nearby the present day elcho castle
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: ]]at the time of wallace's birth king alexander iii had reigned for over twenty years
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: his rule had seen a period of peace and economic stability and he had successfully fended off continuing english claims to suzerainty
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1286 alexander died after falling from his horse none of his children survived him
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the scottish lords declared alexander's four year old granddaughter margaret called the maid of norway queen
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: due to her age they set up an interim government to administer scotland until she came of age
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: king edward i took advantage of the potential instability by arranging the treaty of birgham with the lords betrothing margaret to his son edward on the understanding that scotland would preserve its status as a separate nation
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: but margaret fell ill and died at only eight years old 1290 on her way from her native norway to scotland
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a number of claimants to the scottish throne came forward almost immediately
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: with scotland threatening to descend into a dynastic war the leading men of the realm invited edward's arbitration
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: before the process could begin he insisted that all of the contendors recognize him as lord paramount of scotland
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: after some initial resistance all including john balliol and robert bruce the chief contendors accepted this precondition
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: finally in early november 1292 at a great feudal court held in the castle at berwick upon tweed judgment was given in favour of john balliol having the strongest claim in law
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: formal announcement of the judgment was given by edward on 17 november
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: although the outcome of the great cause had been both fair and legal edward proceeded to use the political concessions he had gained to undermine the independence of scotland and to make king john's position intolerable
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: goaded beyond endurance balliol renounced his homage in march 1296 and by the end of the month edward had stormed berwick upon tweed sacking the then scottish border town with much bloodshed
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he slaughtered almost everyone who resided there even if they fled to the churches
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in april the scots were defeated at the battle of dunbar 1296 in lothian and by july edward had forced balliol to abdicate at kincardine castle
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: edward went to berwick in august to receive formal homage from some 2000 scottish nobles see ragman roll having previously removed the stone of destiny from scone palace the stone on which all of the kings of scots had been crowned
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: harry notes that wallace's father was killed in a skirmish at loudon hill in 1291
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this planted the seed of hatred for the foreign occupation of scotland
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: according to local ayrshire legend two english soldiers challenged wallace in the lanark marketplace regarding his catching of fish
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the argument escalated into a brawl in which the two soldiers were killed
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: blind harry places this incident along the river irvine with five soldiers being killed
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the authorities issued a warrant for his arrest shortly thereafter
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: according to a plaque outside st paul's cathedral in the city of dundee however william wallace began his war for independence by murdering the son of the english governor of dundee after he had made a constant habit of bullying him and his family
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this story perhaps has more weight because it is speculated that wallace may have attended what is now the high school of dundee and spent some of his time growing up in the nearby village of kilspindie
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: blind harry places this bullying incident in lanark which led to a series of incidents described next
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: wallace murdered sir william heselrig the english sheriff of lanark in may 1297 and dismembered his corpse supposedly to avenge the death of marion braidfute of lamington &mdash the young maiden wallace allegedly courted and married in blind harry's tale
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: no evidence exists to corroborate or refute this detail
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: soon he achieved victory in skirmishes at loudoun hill near darvel ayrshire and ayr he also fought alongside sir william douglas in scone routing the english justiciar william ormesby
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: supporters of the growing revolt suffered a major blow when scottish nobles agreed to terms with the english at irvine in july
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in august wallace left selkirk forest with his following to join andrew moray's following at stirling
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: moray began another uprising and their forces combined at stirling where they prepared to meet the english in battle
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is not confirmed what wallace was doing between 1294 and 1296 but harry states that wallace was under the protection of his uncle sir ronald crawford sheriff of ayrshire
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the period from 1291 until 1297 wallace was involved in several actions where the english invariably lost
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: harry states that wallace continually sought the protection of his uncle crawford from the outrage of the english
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is said he sneaked into lanark and killed the english sheriff to avenge marion braidfute his wife according to blind harry
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this would be an ambush
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: around 40 or so of his supporters went with him
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: thanks to his tactics towns such as aberdeen perth glasgow scone dundee and all land north of the forth were freed
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: according to harry these guerrilla tactics eventually led king edward to solve the problem by eliminating most of the council of barons by murdering them in the barns of ayr june 1297 an incident speculated to be invented by blind harry
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a similar hanging party simultaneously convened in renfrewshire
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: sir ronald crawford was the first to be hanged sending wallace who had arrived at the location late after running an errand for his uncle into action and killing the entire english garrison in ayr in a traditional scottish method locking the doors as the garrison slept and firing the flamable structures
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: wallace and his men retired to selkirk forest for safety
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: when word reached the crawford family that sir ronald had been killed sir ronald's son william joined wallace in the forest
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: as wallace's ranks swelled information obtained by john graham prompted wallace to move his force from selkirk forest to the highlands
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: but on the way to the highlands wallace met up with andrew moray at stirling
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: from this point the guerrilla war became open war
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: on 11 september 1297 wallace achieved victory at the battle of stirling bridge
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: although vastly outnumbered the scottish forces led by wallace and andrew moray a more prominent noble being a first son routed the english army
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the earl of surrey's professional army of 300 cavalry and 10000 infantry met disaster as they crossed over to the north side of the river
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the narrowness of the bridge prevented many soldiers from crossing together possibly as few as three men abreast so while the english soldiers crossed the scots held back until half of them had passed and then killed the english as quickly as they could cross
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a pivotal charge was led by hamish campbell wallace's long time companion and one of his captains
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: english soldiers started to retreat as others pushed forward and under the overwhelming weight the bridge collapsed and many english soldiers drowned
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: harry claims that the bridge was rigged to collapse by the action of a man hidden beneath the bridge
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the scots won a significant victory which hugely boosted the confidence of their army
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hugh cressingham edward's treasurer in scotland died in the fighting
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: harry claims cressingham's skin was tanned and used to make trophy belts and sporrans
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: moray died of wounds suffered on the battlefield three months after the battle of stirling bridge
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: william crawford led 400 scottish heavy cavalry to complete the action by running the english out of scotland
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: upon his return from the battle of stirling bridge wallace was knighted along with his second in command john graham and his third in command william crawford possibly by robert the bruce and wallace was named guardian of scotland and leader of its armies now sir william wallace
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the six months following stirling bridge wallace led a force to york at first cleansing the countryside then laying siege to the city
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: his intent was to take the battle to english soil to demonstrate to edward that scotland also had the power to inflict the same sort of damage south of the border
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: naturally edward was infuriated and refused to be intimidated
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a year later the military tables turned at the battle of falkirk
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: on 1 april 1298 the english had invaded scotland at roxburgh
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: they plundered lothian and regained some castles but had failed to bring wallace to combat
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the scots had adopted a scorched earth policy and english suppliers mistakes had left morale and food low but edward's search for wallace would end at falkirk
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: wallace had arranged his spearmen in four schiltrons &mdash circular hedgehog formations surrounded by a defensive wall of wooden stakes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the english gained the upper hand however attacking first with cavalry and wreaking havoc through the scottish archers
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the scottish knights were pulled back by command and edward's men began to attack the schiltrons
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it remains unclear whether the infantry throwing bolts arrows and stones at the spearmen proved the deciding factor although it is very likely that it was the arrows of edward's bowmen
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: either way gaps in the schiltrons soon appeared and the english exploited these to crush the remaining resistance
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the scots lost many men but wallace escaped though his military reputation suffered badly
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: john graham was killed and william crawford became wallace's second
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: according to one account during his flight wallace fought and killed brian de jay master of the english templars in a thicket at callendar
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by september 1298 wallace had decided to resign as guardian of scotland in favour of robert bruce earl of carrick and john comyn of badenoch ex king john balliol's brother in law because of the discouraging lack of commitment and support from the scottish nobility
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: bruce became reconciled with king edward in 1302 while wallace spurned such moves towards peace
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: according to harry wallace left with william crawford in late 1298 on a mission to the court of king philip iv of france le bel of france to plead the case for assistance in the scottish struggle for independence
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: on their trip down the english coast the small convoy ran into the infamous pirate richard longoville also known as the red reiver for his red sails and ruthless raids
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: hiding in the hold of the ship while crawford and a small contingent of men sailed the ship wallace surprised the pirates as they boarded the ship after grappling them together
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: longoville was captured and taken to paris where the scots convinced phillip to grant amnesty so that longoville could wreak havoc on english ships
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: but after serving with the scots guard in france in two supposed military victories over the english as well as a side trip to rome to plead for scotland in 1303 wallace and his men returned to scotland where they slipped in under the cover of darkness to recover on the farm of william crawford near elcho wood
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: having heard rumors of wallace's appearance in the area the english moved in on the farm
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a chase ensued and the band of men slipped away after being completely surrounded in elcho wood
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is at this point in the chase where wallace took the life of one of his men that he suspected of hidden loyalty in order to divert the english from the trail
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: sir william evaded capture by the english until 5 august 1305 when sir john de menteith a scottish knight loyal to edward turned wallace over to english soldiers at robroyston near glasgow
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: wallace was transported to london and tried for treason at westminster hall where he was crowned with a garland of oak to suggest that he was the king of outlaws
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he responded to the charge i could not be a traitor to edward for i was never his subject the absent john balliol was officially his king however wallace was declared guilty
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: on 23 august 1305 following the trial wallace was removed from the courtroom stripped naked and dragged at the heels of a horse to smithfield market
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he was drawn and quartered strangled by hanging but released near death emasculated eviscerated beheaded then divided into four parts the four horrors at the elms in smithfield
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: his head was placed on a pike atop london bridge which was later joined by the heads of his brother john and sir simon fraser
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: his limbs were displayed separately in newcastle berwick stirling and aberdeen
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a sword which supposedly belonged to wallace was held for many years in dumbarton castle and is now in the wallace national monument near stirling
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: however examination of the sword by experts has concluded that its design belongs to a period a few centuries after wallace
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: an insignificant amount of comprehensive and historically accurate information was written about wallace
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: many stories however are based on the wandering 15th century minstrel blind harry's epic poem the acts and deeds of sir william wallace knight of elderslie written around 1470
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: historians disagree with parts of blind harry's tale or dismiss the entire composition
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: although blind harry wrote from oral tradition describing events 170 years earlier giving rise to alterations of fact harry's work still remains the most authoritative description of wallace's exploits
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: indeed much of harry's work is supported by circumstantial evidence including names from land charters the ragman roll and religious and public office holders and their archives
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: while not all details are consistent the general flow is consistent with contemporary histories
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it should be noted that the bishop of st andrew's did commission a friar to write a first hand account of wallace's exploits but the disposition of this manuscript is not known
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: blind harry's poem barns of ayr for example describes the incident when three hundred and sixty scottish nobles led by wallace's uncle sir ronald crawford were summoned by the english to a conference in spring of 1297
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: as each passed through a narrow entry a rope was dropped around his neck and he was hanged
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is speculated this incident did not occur assuming blind harry misread a line from an earlier poem about robert the bruce which tells how certain scottish nobles were hanged in ar a legal term meaning by a circuit court
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: however there is no evidence that harry ever read the earlier poem
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the incident as described by blind harry does appear in the 1995 film braveheart with much less accuracy placing the event in the childhood of wallace and igoring the murder of his uncle crawford
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: nevertheless sir ronald crawford did die at this time and his son replaced him as sheriff of ayrshire giving some credence to the story
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the early 19th century sir walter scott wrote of wallace in exploits and death of william wallace the hero of scotland and jane porter penned a romantic version of the wallace legend in the scottish chiefs in 1810
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: ga henty wrote a novel in 1885 about this time period titled in freedom's cause
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: henty a producer of boys own fiction who wrote for that magazine portrays the life of william wallace robert the bruce the black douglas and others while dovetailing the novel with historical fiction
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: nigel tranter authored an intended fiction titled the wallace published in 1975 which is said by academics to be more accurate than its literary predecessors
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: perhaps the best known account of the life of william wallace is the 1995 film braveheart directed by and starring mel gibson and written by randall wallace
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this film has been criticized for its considerable historical inaccuracies but was a commercial and critical success winning five academy awards including best picture and best director
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the game age of empires ii the age of kings contains several of wallace's battles in its campaign mode including the battle of stirling bridge
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 2005 the 700th anniversary of wallace's execution his sword became the most popular feature of an exhibition in new york during the celebrations of tartan week
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this marked the first time the sword weighing 6 pounds 2.5 kilograms and measuring five feet and four inches was removed from scotland
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: historian david r ross walked 450 miles from robroyston in glasgow scotland to london to mark the anniversary of wallace's capture and execution
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a symbolic funeral was then held at the site of wallace's execution in smithfield london with an empty coffin
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: while the event hosted 300 attendees more than 900 people unsuccessfully applied for tickets to the event &mdash a testament to wallace's enduring legacy
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: न्यु जिल्यान्द दक्षिण पश्चिमी प्रशान्त महासागरय् निगु तधंगु व यक्व चिधंगु तापूइ अवस्थित छगू देय् ख। थ्व देय्या जनजाति माओरीतयेगु भाषाय् थ्व देय्या नां आओतेअरोआ aotearoa ख गुकिया अर्थ ताःहाकःगु तुयु सुपाँय्या देय् ख। रेल्म अफ न्युजिल्यान्दय् कूक तापु व निउइ स्वसाशित व स्वतन्त्र सम्बन्धित व तोकेलाउ व रस दिनेन्देन्सी न्युजिल्यान्दया एन्तार्क्तिकाय् दावी यानातःगु थाय् नं ला।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: तार्किक शास्त्र वा तर्क वैध प्रदर्शन व अनुमानया सिद्धान्तया सीकेज्या ख। तर्क दर्शनया छगू शाखा ख शास्त्रीय triviumया छगू भाग ख व नापं गणितया छगू शाखा ख।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: तार्किक फार्मया अवधारणा तर्कया केन्द्रय् ला। तार्किक संस्कृतिइ छगू तर्कया वैधता उकिया तार्किक रूपय् आधारित जुइ व उकिया सामग्रीइ निर्धारित जुइमखु। पारम्परिक एरिस्टोटलियन सिल्लोजिस्टिक aristotelian syllogistic तर्क व आधुनिक प्रतीकात्मक तर्क औपचारिक तार्किकीया दसु ख।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: लोकं येकुगु संगीतयात लोक संगीत folk music धाई।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: संस्कृत खँग्वसफू
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: म्यांग्यानिज छगू रसायनिक तत्त्व ख। थ्व तत्त्वया रसायनिक चिं mn व एतमिक ल्या २५ ख। प्रकृतिइ थ्व तत्त्व स्वतन्त्र रुपय् दयाच्वनिमखु। थ्व तत्त्व आपालं नँनाप खानीइ स्वानाच्वनि। थ्व तत्त्वं औद्योगिक मिश्रधातु दयेकेछिं। थ्व तत्त्व स्तेनलेस स्तिल दयेकेत छ्येलिगु या। ऐतिहासिक रुपय् म्यांग्यानिज नां ग्रीसया म्याग्नेसिया धाःगु थाय्या नामं वःगु ख। मध्य १८गू सदीइ स्विदिस-जर्मन रसायनविद कार्ल विल्हेम स्किलं पाइरोलुसाइत छ्येला क्लोरिन उत्पादन यानादिल। स्किल व अन्य रसायनविदतेसं पाइरोजुसाइत(म्यांग्यानिज अक्साइद)य् न्हूगु तत्त्व दूगु खँ स्यूगु जुसां वय्कपिंसं थ्व तत्त्वयात प्रशोधन यायेमफत। थ्व तत्त्वयात शुद्ध रुपय् प्रशोधन यायेगु ज्या सर्वप्रथम योहान गत्लिब गान johan gottlieb gahn धाम्ह रसायनविदं यानादिल। वय्कलं सन १७७४स दाइअक्साइदयात कार्बन तत्त्वं रिदुस यानादिल।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: क्यान्सर दायग्नोस यायेत साधारनतया मनुया म्हया सम्बन्धित तिस्यु लिकाना उकिया हिस्तोलोजिक जांच यायेमा। थन्यागु जांच प्याथोलोजिस्तं याइ। छुं क्यान्सरया न्हापांगु लक्षण रेदियोग्राफिक किपालं नं खनेदै। आपालं क्यान्सरतयेगु निदान क्यान्सरया प्रकार थाय् व क्यान्सरया स्तेजं प्रभावित याइ। छकः दायग्नोसिस जुइधुंका क्यान्सरयात सर्जरी किमोथेरापी व रेदियसन थेरापी छ्यला लंकिगु कुतः यायेछिं। क्यान्सरया मालेज्या(research)या विकास नापं थी-थी क्यान्सरया थी-थी उपचार लुया वयाच्वंगु दु। तार्गेतेद केमोथेरापीइ यक्व विकास जुयाच्वंगु दु।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: संयुक्त राष्ट्रीय मचा कोष संयुक्त राष्ट्र संघयागु मचातेगु व मचातेगु मांपिंत ग्वाहालि यायेगु ह(branch ख:| थ्व गुथियागु पुलांगु नां युनिसेफ आ नं प्रचलनय् दु| थ्व कोषयागु मूज्यास न्हु यर्कय् दु|
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: canals are artificial channels for water
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: there are two types of canals water conveyance canals which are used for the conveyance and delivery of water and waterways which are navigable transportation canals used for passage of goods and people often connected to existing lakes rivers or oceans
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for canals used for water supply see aqueduct
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: some canals are part of an existing waterway
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this is usually where a river has been canalised making it navigable by widening and deepening some parts by dredging and or weirs and providing locks with cuts around the weirs or other difficult sections
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in france these are called lateral canals and in the uk they are generally called navigations and the length of the artificial waterway often exceeds the natural
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: smaller transportation canals can carry barges or narrowboats while ship canals allow seagoing ships to travel to an inland port eg manchester ship canal or from one sea or ocean to another eg caledonian canal kiel canal
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: at their simplest canals consist of a trench filled with water
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: depending on the stratum the canal passes through it may be necessary to line the cut with some form of watertight material such as clay or concrete
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: when this is done with clay this is known as puddling
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: canals need to be flat and while small irregularities in the lie of the land can be dealt with through cuttings and embankments for larger deviations other approaches have been adopted
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the most common is the pound lock which consists of a chamber within which the water level can be raised or lowered connecting either two pieces of canal at a different level or the canal with a river or the sea
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: when there is a hill to be climbed flights of many locks in short succession may be used
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: prior to the development of the pound lock in 984ad in china by chhaio wei yo and later in europe in the 15th century either flash locks consisting of a single gate were used or ramps sometimes equipped with rollers were used to change level
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: flash locks were only practical where there was plenty of water available
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: locks use a lot of water so builders have adopted other approaches
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these include boat lifts such as the falkirk wheel which use a caisson of water in which boats float while being moved between two levels and inclined planes where a caisson is hauled up a steep railway
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: to cross a stream or road the solution is usually to bridge with an aqueduct
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: to cross a wide valley where the journey delay caused by a flight of locks at either side would be unacceptable the centre of the valley can be spanned by an aqueduct a famous example in wales is the pontcysyllte aqueduct across the valley of the river dee
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: another option when dealing with hills is to tunnel through them
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: an example of this approach is the harecastle tunnel on the trent and mersey canal
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: tunnels are only practical for smaller canals
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: some canals attempted to keep changes in level down to a minimum
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these canals known as contour canals would take longer winding routes along which the land was a uniform altitude
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: other generally latter canals took more direct routes requiring the use of various methods to deal with the change in level
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: canals have various features to tackle the problem of water supply
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in some cases such as the suez canal the canal is simply open to the sea
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: where the canal is not at sea level a number of approaches have been adopted
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: taking water from existing rivers or springs was an option in some cases sometimes supplemented by other methods to deal with seasonal variations in flow
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: where such sources were unavailable reservoirs either separate from the canal or built into its course and back pumping were used to provide the required water
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in other cases water pumped from mines was used to feed the canal
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: where large amounts of good are loaded or unloaded such as the end of a canal a canal basin may be built
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this would normally be a section of water wider than the general canal
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in some cases the canal basin contain wharfs and cranes to assist with movement of goods
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the oldest known canals were built in mesopotamia circa 4000 bc in what is now modern day iraq and syria
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the indus valley civilization in pakistan and north india from circa 2600 bc had a sophisticated canal irrigation system
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: agriculture was practised on a large scale and an extensive network of canals was used for the purpose of irrigation
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: sophisticated irrigation and storage systems were developed including the reservoirs built at girnar in 3000 bc in egypt canals date back at least to the time of pepi i meryre reigned 2332 - 2283 bc who ordered a canal built to bypass the cataract on the nile near aswan
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in ancient china large canals for river transport were established as far back as the warring states 481-221 bc the longest one of that period being the hong gou canal of the wild geese which according to the ancient historian sima qian connected the old states of song zhang chen cai cao and wei
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by far the longest canal was the grand canal of china still the longest canal in the world today
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is long and was built to carry the emperor yang guang between beijing and hangzhou
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the project began in 605 and was completed in 609 although much of the work combined older canals the oldest section of the canal existing since at least 486 bc even in its narrowest urban sections it is rarely less than wide
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the naviglio grande near milan was the first artificial canal in medieval europe and the most important of the lombard navigli started in 1127 and opened in 1257 allowing development of commerce transport and agriculture
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: canal building was revived in this age because of commercial expansion from the 12th century ad river navigations were improved progressively by the use of single or flash locks
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: taking boats through these used large amounts of water leading to conflicts with watermill owners and to correct this the pound or chamber lock first appeared in 10th century ad in china and in europe in 1373 in vreeswijk netherlands
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: another important development was the mitre gate which was probably introduced in italy by bertola da novate in the sixteenth century
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this allowed wider gates and also removed the height restriction of guillotine locks
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: to break out of the limitations caused by river valleys the first summit level canals were developed with the grand canal of china in 581-617 ad whilst in europe the first also using single locks was the stecknitz canal in germany in 1398
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the first to use pound locks was the briare canal connecting the loire and seine catchment areas in france 1642 followed by the more ambitious canal du midi 1683 connecting the atlantic to the mediterranean
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this included a staircase of 8 locks at beziers a tunnel and three major aqueducts
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: canal building progressed steadily in germany in the 17th and 18th centuries with three great rivers the elbe oder and weser being linked by canals
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in post roman britain the first canal built appears to have been the exeter canal which opened in 1563
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the oldest canal built for industrial purposes in north america is mother brook in dedham ma it was constructed in 1639 to provide water power for mills
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in russia the volga baltic waterway a nationwide canal system connecting the baltic and caspian seas via the neva and volga rivers was opened in 1718
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the greatest stimulus to canal systems came from the industrial revolution with its need for cheap transport of raw materials and manufactured items
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in europe particularly britain and ireland and then in the young united states and the canadian colonies inland canals preceded the development of railroads during the earliest phase of the industrial revolution
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the opening of the bridgewater canal in 1761 which halved the price of coal in manchester triggered a period of canal mania in britain so that between 1760 and 1820 over one hundred canals were built
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the united states navigable canals reached into isolated areas and brought them in touch with the world beyond
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by 1825 the erie canal long with 82 locks opened up a connection from the populated northeast to the fertile great plains
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the blackstone canal in massachusetts and rhode island fulfilled a similar role in the early industrial revolution between 1828-1848
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the blackstone valley was considered the birthplace of the american industrial revolution where samuel slater built his first mill
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in addition to their transportation purposes parts of the united states particularly in the northeast had enough fast flowing rivers that water power was the primary means of powering factories usually textile mills until after the american civil war
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example lowell massachusetts considered to be the cradle of the american industrial revolution has of canals built from around 1790 to 1850 that provided water power and a means of transportation for the city
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the output of the system is estimated at 10000 horsepower
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: other cities with extensive power canal systems include lawrence massachusetts holyoke massachusetts and manchester new hampshire
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: competition from the railway network from the 1830s and later the roads made the smaller canals obsolete for commercial transportation and most of the british canals fell into decay
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: only the manchester ship canal and the aire and calder canal bucked this trend
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: but in other countries canals grew in size as construction techniques improved
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: during the 19th century in the us the length of canals grew from to over 4000 with a complex network making the great lakes navigable in conjunction with canada although some canals were later drained and used as railroad rights of way
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in france a steady linking of all the river systems—rhine rhone saone and seine—and the north sea was boosted in 1879 by the establishment of the freycinet gauge which specified the minimum size of locks so that canal traffic doubled in the first decades of the 20th century
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: many notable sea canals were completed in this period starting with the suez canal 1869 and the kiel canal 1897 which carries tonnage many times that of most other canals though the panama canal was not opened until 1914
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the 19th century a number of canals were built in japan including the biwako canal and the tone canal
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these canals were partially built with the help of engineers from the netherlands and other countries
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: large scale ship canals such as the panama canal and suez canal continue to operate for cargo transportation as do european barge canals
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: due to globalization they are becoming increasingly important resulting in expansion projects such as the panama canal expansion project
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the narrow early industrial canals however have ceased to carry significant amounts of trade and many have been abandoned to navigation but may still be used as a system for transportation of untreated water
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in some cases railways have been built along the canal route an example being the croydon canal
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a movement that began in britain and france to use the early industrial canals for pleasure boats has spurred rehabilitation of stretches of historic canals
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in some cased abandoned canals such as the kennet and avon canal have been restored and are now used by pleasure boaters
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in britain canalside housing has also proven popular in recent years
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the seine nord europe canal is being developed into a major transportation waterway linking france with belgium germany and the netherlands
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: canals have found another use in the 21st century as wayleaves along the towing paths for fibre optic telecommunications networks
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: canals are so deeply identified with venice that many canal cities have been nicknamed the venice of the city is built on marshy islands with wooden piles supporting the buildings so that the land is man made rather than the waterways
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the islands have a long history of settlement by the 12th century venice was a powerful city state
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: amsterdam was built in a similar way with buildings on wooden piles
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the pace of draining of fenland and polder in the low countries quickened in the 14th century and canalization made the village of amsterdam a port
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it became a city around 1300
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: other cities with extensive canal networks include brugge in flanders birmingham in england saint petersburg in russia hamburg in germany and fort lauderdale florida in the united states
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: canal estates are a form of subdivision popular in cities like miami florida and the gold coast queensland the gold coast has over 700 km of residential canals
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: wetlands are difficult areas upon which to build housing estates so dredging part of the wetland down to a navigable channel provides fill to build up another part of the wetland above the flood level for houses
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: land is built up in a finger pattern that provides a suburban street layout of waterfront housing blocks
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this practice is not popular with environmentalists
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: inland canals have often have had boats specifically built for them
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: an example of this is the british narrowboat which is up to long and wide and was primarily built for british midland canals
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in this case the limiting factor was the size of the locks
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this is also the limiting factor on the panama canal where panamax boats are limited to a length of 294.1 metres and a width of 32.3 metres
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for the lockless suez canal the limiting factor for suezmaxes is generally draft which is limited to 16 metres
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: at the other end of the scale tub boat canals such as the bude canal were limited to boats of under 10 tons for much of their length due to the capacity of their inclined planes or boat lifts
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: most canals have a limit on height imposed either by bridges or tunnels
lines.name: Newar

lines.name: Newar

lines.value: धमनी artery धागु छगु कथंयागु हिधों blood vessel खः। थ्व हिनू नं हियात नुगनं कोष तक्क यंकिगु ज्या याई।

lines.value: थ्व छगु तत्त्व एलेमेन्ट ख। थ्व धातु मानक क्वाजः व चापय् झझखाइगु वहःथें-तुइसे च्वनिगु व भति-भति रियाक्टिभ जुइय। केमिकल रियाक्सनय् थ्व धातुं थःगु निगु भ्यालेन्स इलेक्ट्रोन अपुइक हे त्वता +2 चार्जया क्याटआयन जुइ। थ्व धातुया दकले पिनेया इलेक्ट्रोन एस अर्बाइटलय् लाःगु जुगुलिं थ्व धातु पिरियोडिक टेबलया s-ब्लकय् ला। थ्व धातु पृथ्वीइ प्राकृतिक रुपय् दु।

lines.value: गेमेलान धागु छगु कथंयागु इन्डोनेसियाली सांगीतिक परम्परा खः। थुकिलि मेटालोफोन जाइलोफोन ड्रम गंग पंयागु बांसुरी तार बाजं व मेहालिम्ह थें न्यागु चीजत दै। a gamelan as a set of instruments is a distinct entity built and tuned to stay together - instruments from different gamelan are not interchangeable
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the word gamelan comes from the javanese word gamel meaning to strike or hammer and the malay indonesian suffix an makes the root a collective noun
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: gamelan are found in the indonesian islands of java madura bali and lombok and other sunda islands in a wide variety of ensemble sizes and formations
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in bali and lombok today and in java through the 18th century the term gong has been preferred to or synonymous with gamelan
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: traditions of gamelan like ensembles sometimes called gong chime ensembles by ethnomusicologists also exist in the philippines malaysia and suriname sometimes due to emigration trade or diplomacy
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: more recently through immigration and local enthusiasm gamelan ensembles have become active throughout europe the americas asia and australia
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: although gamelan ensembles sometimes include solo and choral voices plucked and or bowed string and wind instruments they are most notable for the large number of metal percussion instruments
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a central javanese gamelan ensemble includes metals used include bronze brass and iron with a 10:3 copper to tin bronze alloy usually considered the best material
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in addition there are gamelan ensembles composed entirely of bamboo keyed instruments of bamboo flutes of zithers or of unaccompanied voices with the functions of metallophones or gongs in the metal ensemble transferred to surrogates
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: there are many ways to look at the musical structure of gamelan music
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: one is to consider three layers a fixed melodic outline with punctuated by lower pitched instruments and decorated by higher pitched instruments
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a javanese classification also adds a leader of the melody and a leader of time
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: many of the music forms will be marked at the end by the largest gong in the ensemble although there are some exceptions
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: [[किपा:traditional_indonesian_instrument_being_played_at_the_indonesian_embassy.jpg|thumb|250px|playing gamelan instruments bpk
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: soegito at the indonesian embassy in canberra.]]
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: gamelan is often used to accompany dance wayang puppet performances and rituals
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: some performances are associated with royalty such as visits by the sultan of yogyakarta
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: certain gamelans are associated with rituals such as the gamelan sekaten which is used in celebration of mawlid an nabi muhammad's birthday
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in bali almost all religious rituals include gamelan performance
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the west gamelan is often performed in a concert context but may also incorporate dance or wayang
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the tuning and construction of a gamelan orchestra is a complex process
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: javanese gamelans use two tuning systems slendro and pelog
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: there are other tuning systems such as degung exclusive to sunda or west java and madenda also known as diatonis similar to a european natural minor scale
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in central javanese gamelan slendro is a system with five notes to the diapason octave fairly evenly spaced while pelog has seven notes to the octave with uneven intervals usually played in five note subsets of the seven tone collection
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this results in sound quite different from music played in a western tuning system
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: many gamelan orchestras will include instruments in each tuning but each individual instrument will only be able to play notes in one
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the precise tuning used differs from ensemble to ensemble and give each ensemble its own particular flavour
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: colin mcphee 1966 remarks deviations in what is considered the same scale are so large that one might with reason state that there are as many scales as there are gamelans however this is a view that is contested by some teachers of gamelan and there have been efforts to combine multiple ensembles and tuning structures into one gamelan so as to ease transportation issues at the times of festivals
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: one such ensemble is gamelan manikasanti which can play the repertoire of many different ensembles
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a peculiarity of gamelans is that although the intervals between notes in a scale are very close to identical for different instruments within each gamelan the intervals vary from one gamelan to the next
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the occasion for the word approximately is that it is common in balinese gamelan that instruments are played in pairs which are tuned slightly apart so as to produce interference beating which are ideally at a consistent speed for all pairs of notes in all registers
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is thought that this contributes to the very busy and shimmering sound of gamelan ensembles
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the religious ceremonies that contain gamelan these interference beats are meant to give the listener a feeling of a god's presence or a stepping stone to a meditative state
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the gamelan has been appreciated by several western composers of classical music most famously claude debussy who heard a javanese gamelan play at the paris exposition of 1889 world's fair
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the gamelan debussy heard was in the near diatonic madenda scale and was played by sundanese musicians despite his enthusiasm direct citations of gamelan scales melodies rhythms or ensemble textures have not been located in any of debussy's own compositions
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: however the equal tempered pentatonic scale appears in his music of this time and afterward and a javanese gamelan like heterophonic texture is emulated on occasion particularly in pagodes from estampes solo piano 1903 in which the great gong's cyclic punctuation is symbolized by a prominent perfect fifth
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: direct homages to gamelan music are to be found in works for western instruments by bela bartok francis poulenc olivier messiaen colin mcphee benjamin britten and steve reich
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in more recent times american composers such as barbara benary lou harrison dennis murphy michael tenzer evan ziporyn daniel james wolf and jody diamond as well as australian composers such as peter sculthorpe andrew schultz and ross edwards have written several works with parts for gamelan instruments or full gamelan ensembles
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: i nyoman windha is among contemporary indonesian composers that have written compositions using western instruments along with gamelan
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: american folk guitarist john fahey included elements of gamelan in many of his late 60s sound collages and again in his 1997 collaboration with cul de sac the epiphany of glenn jones
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the experimental art rock band king crimson while not using gamelan instruments used interlocking rhythmic paired guitars that were influenced by gamelan
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: experimental pop groups his name is alive and xiu xiu use gamelan percussion in many songs
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the avant garde group the residents have also used gamelan in their music particularly in their 1976 album fingerprince

lines.value: म्ये song music धाःगु छगू प्रकारया कला ख। थ्व कलाय् मनुया सः व बाजंया सः थीथी सुर व तालय् ल्वाकछ्यायेगु जुइ। हलिमया थीथी थासय् थीथीकथंया म्ये खनेदु। म्ये हालिगु चलनया विकास नं हलिमया थाय्‌ अनुसार भतिचा-अप्व पा। यक्व लहनाय् थ्व तजिलजिया अभिन्न अंग जुयाच्वनेधुंकूगु दु। सः ताल राग आदि म्येया थीथी कुचा ख।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: संकिपा motion picture धागु २०औं व २१औं शताब्दीयागु दक्ले अप्व न्ह्याइपुइकिगु साधनय् छगु खः। संकिपायात थी-थी कथं बायेछिं। संकिपाया थ्व चीहाकःगु इतिहासय् थ्व ख्यलय् यक्व विकास जूगु दु। ऐतिहासिक विकासया आधारय् संकिपा न्हापा सः मदूगु युगं सः दूगु युगय् व हाकु-तुयु संकिपां रंगीन संकिपाय् व २दि ३दि जुजुं ४दिइ विकास जुल। नापं संकिपाया सः सराउन्द साउन्द किपा हाइ रिजोलुसन व संकिपा दबूया प्राविधिक पक्ष नं बल्लाना वयाच्वंगु दु। संकिपायात थी-थी रुपय् बायेछिं।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिकाया दक्षिणी भूभागया छगु राज्य ख। थ्व राज्यया नां कापः आदिवासीतयेगु quapaw indians एल्गोन्कियन algonquian नां ख। आर्कान्सःया सीमाना खुगु राज्यया सीमानाप स्वा। थ्व राज्यया उत्तरय् मिसौरी पूर्वय् टेनिसी व मिसिसिप्पी दसिणय् लुइजियाना दक्षिण पश्चिमय् टेक्सास व पश्चिमय् ओक्लाहोमा ला। थ्व राज्यया पूर्वी सीमा आपालं मिसिमिप्पी खुसिं निर्धारणया। थ्व राज्यया वृहद भौगोलिक क्षेत्रफलय् ओजार्क्स व ओउचिया च्वापुगुं लागा निसें पूर्वी मिसिसिपी खुसिया क्षेत्र तक्क ला। थ्व राज्यया राजधानी व दक्ले तधंगु नगर लिटल रक ख।

lines.value: चीनय् दबू प्याखंया छगू तःधंगु तजिलजि दु। चिनिया दबू प्याखं अःपू लिपिइ 戏曲 परम्परागत लिपिइ 戲曲 पिन्यिन् xiqu jyutping hei3kuk1 pe̍h-oe-ji hi-khek हलिंया छगू नांजाःगु दबू म्ये-प्याखं ख। थ्व दबूप्याखंया पलिस्था प्राचीन चीनय् जूगु ख। थी-थी तत्त्व दूगु थ्व दबू प्याखं प्राचीन चीनय् दयाच्वंगु थी-थी दबूकलायात समिस्रित यासें बुयावःगु छगू उन्नत कला ख। शदीयौं शदी तक्क परिष्कृत जुसें थ्व कलां थःगु निश्चित रुप १३गू शदीइ सोङ्ग राजवंशया इलय् काल। थ्व दबूप्याखंया दकलय् न्हापांगु रुप सरल जुसां समयनापं विस्तार जुसें संगीत म्ये प्याखं सामरिक कला एक्रोब्यातिक्स आदि थीथी कलात्मक तत्त्वतेत दुथ्यासें थ्व कलां थःगु आधुनिक दबू प्याखंया रुपय् विकशित जूगु दु। थ्व कला छगू मंका कला ख। थुकिया दुने नं थाय् सम्प्रदाय आदिया आधारय् थीथी उप-विधात दु। थन्यागु उपविधाय् दकलय् नांजाःगु उपविधा पेकिङ ओपेरा बेइजिङया दबू म्ये-प्याखं वा जिङ्जु ख।

lines.value: अलिफ लैला व-लैला वा किताब अलिफ लैला व-लैला अरबी भासय् كتاب ألف ليلة وليلة वा kitab alf laylah wa laylah छगू पश्चिम व दक्षिण एसियाया बाखँमुना ख। थ्व बाखँमुनाया बाखँ अरबी भासय् इस्लामी स्वर्ण युगय् मुनातःगु ख। थुकियात अरेबियन नाइत्स् arabian nights)या नामं नं म्हसीकिगु या। थ्व नां थ्व सफूया न्हापांगु अंग्रेजी भाय्‌‌हिला सन् १७०६स पिथंगु द अरेबियन नाइत्स् एन्तरतेन्मेन्त the arabian nights entertainment')या चीहाकःगु नां ख। थ्व सफूलि थीथी शदीया थीथी च्वमि भाय्‌हिलामि व विज्ञतेसं पश्चिम मध्य दक्षिण एसिया व उत्तर अफ्रिकाय् दूगु थीथी बाखँ मुंकातःगु दु। थ्व सफूया बाखँत आपालं प्राचीन व मध्यकालीन अरबी पारसी भारतीय मिस्रमि मेसोपोतामियामितेगु दन्त्यकथा व साहित्यय् आधारित दु। थ्व सफूलि यक्व बाखँ खलिफत युगया दूगु व छुं बाखँ इरानया पल्लवि युगया हजार अफ्सान hazar afsan वा هزار افسان अर्थ:द्वछि बाखँ धाःगु सफूलिं प्रेरित जूगु व हजार अफ्सान सफूलि थीथी भारतीय तत्त्व दयाच्वंगुलिं थुकिलि भारतीय प्रभाव नं खनेदूगु ख।

lines.value: परापूर्व वा प्रागितिहास धाःगु ऐतिहासिक दस्ताबेजस्वया न्ह्यः वा च्वयेगु व्यवस्था स्वया न्ह्यःया ऐतिहासिक काल ख। थ्व कालखण्ड मानव इतिहास लिपिबद्ध जुइ स्वया न्ह्यःया कालखण्ड ख। वृहदरुपय् थ्व कालखण्डय् मनुनं च्वये सयेस्वया न्ह्यःया सकल आविष्कार व लुइकूगु ज्ञान ला। पुरातत्त्वविद पल तर्नाल paul tournal नं दक्षिण फ्रान्सया गुफाय् लूइकूगु खँ वर्णन यायेत खँग्वः ante-historique छ्यलादिल। थ्व कथं इतिहास-पूर्व वा प्रागितिहासिक खँग्वःया अर्थ दूगु खँग्वः दकलय् न्ह्यः फ्रान्सय् १८३०या दशकय् छुत। लिपा अंग्रेजीइ पुरातत्त्वविद देनिल विल्सन daniel wilson जुं सन् १८५१स थ्व खँग्वःयात prehistory धका छ्यलादिल।<ref name="simpson"> <ref name="wilson scotland">
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: एदेनोमा ग्लान्दुलर मूलया छता बिनाइन त्युमर -oma)। एदेनोमा यक्व अंगय् बुइफु दसु कोलोन एद्रेनल ग्रन्थि पितुइतरी ग्रन्थि थाइरोइद प्रोस्त्रेत आदि। थन्यागु त्युमर बिनाइन जुसां समयनापं थ्व लिपा म्यालिग्नेन्त जुइफु। अथेजुसा थुकियात एदेनोकार्सिनोमा धाइ। बिनाइन हे जुसां थन्यागु त्युमरतेसं गंभीर उसाँय् समस्या हयेफु दसु थुकिया आकारं मेमेगु अंगय् दवाब बीफु वा तःच्वःगु मात्राय् म्वागु हर्मोन दयेकेफु।

lines.value: भर्जिल मेसिनाजतेगु पुचःया छम्ह सदस्य जुयादिल। थ्व पुचः अक्टेभियनयागु agent d'affaires ख व इमिसं मार्क एन्थोनीया खलःयात कमजोर यायेत रोमन च्वमितेत अक्टेभियनया पहं लिनेगु ज्या यानादिल। वय्‌कलं थ्व हे झ्वले होरेस व भेरियस रुफुज वय्‌कलं एनीड क्वचायेकेत ग्वाहालि यानादीपिं नापलानादिल। एकोलग्स सीधेके धुंका वय्‌कलं इ॰ पू॰ ३७-इ॰ पू॰ २९इ ज्योर्जिक्स बुंज्याय् च्वयेगु सिधेकादिल व थुकियात वय्‌कलं मेसीयन्सतेत देछानादिल।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: ताओ धर्म चीनी 道教 दाओ-ज्याओ चीन यागु छगु मू धर्म व दर्शन खः। न्हापा ताओ छगु धर्म मजुया दर्शन व जीवनशैली यागु कथलं वगु खः । लिपा बौद्ध धर्म यागु चीन थ्येने धुंका ताओ नं बौद्धत नाप यक्व धारणा थिंका काल व छगु धर्म जु वन। बौद्ध धर्म व ताओ धर्मय् ई-ईले अहिंसात्मक संघर्ष नं जुइ। ताओ धर्म व दर्शन निगुगु हे स्रोत दार्शनिक लाओ-त्सी नं स्वगु ग्रन्थ दाओ-दे-चिंग व ज़ुआंग-ज़ी खः ।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: माइकलएंजेलो दि लोदोभिको बुओनारोट्टी सिमोनी इटालियानो:michelangelo di lodovico buonarroti simoni मार्च ६ १४७५ - फेब्रुवरी १८ १५६४ लोकभासय् माइकलएंजेलो छम्ह इटालियन रिनायसान्स मूर्तिकार किपामि वास्तुशास्त्री व चिनाखँमि ख। युरोपया पूनर्जागरण कालय् कला क्षेत्रय् वय्‌कलं यानादीगु योगदानया निंतिं वय्‌कःयात लुमंकीगु या। कलाक्षेत्रय् वय्‌कलं ल्हा तयाःदीगु सकल हे ख्यलय् वय्‌कःया ज्या तसकं हे भिंगु जूगु विशेषज्ञतेगु विचा‌ः दु। वर्तमानय् दयाच्वंगु वय्‌कःया सकल ज्या किपा मूर्ति स्थापत्य चिनाखँ आदि स्वयेबिलय् वय्‌कः १६गू शदीया दकलय् भिंकः दस्ताबेज दूम्ह कलाकारय् छम्ह खः। वय्‌कयाः दकलय् लोकंह्वागु निता ज्या पियत व डेभिडया निर्माण वय्‌कः २०-४०दँ या दथुइ दयेकादीगु ख। वय्‌कलं थ्वःगु जीवनय् यक्व किपा दयेकामदीसां वय्‌कलं सिस्तिन् च्यापेलया सिलिंग व अल्तार अंगलय् दयेकादीगु द लास्ट जज्मेन्ट निताः अंगःकिपातेत fresco पाश्चात्य जगतया दकलय् प्रभावशाली किपाया रुपय् कायेगु या। वय्‌कलं सेन्त पिटरया ब्यासिलिकाया दोम दयेकुसें पिलास्टर शैलीया आविष्कार याना दिल। थ्व आविष्कारं पाश्चात्य शास्त्रीय स्थापत्य हलिमय् छता क्रान्ति हे हलः।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: स्पेन आधिकारिक कथं स्पेन राजतन्त्र स्पेनया भासय् reino de espana चिहाकलं espana छगू दक्षिण युरोपेली देय् खः। थ्व देय्‌या निता भूभाग उत्तर अफ्रिकाय् नं दु। थ्व देय् राजनैतिक कथं संवैधानिक राजतन्त्र ख:। आइबेरियन प्रायद्विपया स्वंगु देय्-स्पेन पोर्तुगाल व एन्दोराय् दकलय् तःधंगु देय् थ्व हे खः। ग्यालिसियाया पश्चिम व दक्षिणय् स्पेन व पोर्तुगलया सीमा स्वा। थ्व देय्‌या दक्षिणय् जिब्राल्टर जलसन्धि ला धाःसा उत्तरपूर्वय् पाइरिनी पर्वतमालाय् फ्रान्स व एन्दोरा ला। थ्व देसय् भूमध्यसागरया ब्यालेरिक टापू आन्ध्र सागरया क्यानारी टापू व भूमध्यसागरय् जिब्राल्टर नापंया प्लाजाज् दे सोबरानिया धाःगु टापू नं ला। थ्व देय्‌या उत्तरपूर्वय् पाइरिनीइ लिभिया धाःगु थ्व देय्‌या चिधंगु नगरया फ्रान्सेली भूभागं प्यखें घेरेयानातःगु दु।

lines.value: कार्बोन वा कार्बन एटमिक ल्याखँ ६ दूगु व रसायनिक चिं c दूगु छगू रासायनिक तत्व ख। पिरियोडिक टेबलय् समूह १४या छगू सदस्य जूगुलिं थ्व तत्त्व अधातु व टेट्राभ्यालेन्ट जुइ अतः थुकिया प्यंगु इलेक्ट्रोन कोभ्यालेन्ट रासायनिक बण्ड देकेया निंतिं उपलब्ध जुइ। कार्बोनया ३गु प्राकृतिक आइसोटोप खने दु। थुकिलि १२ c व १३ c स्थिर stable जुइ धाःसा १४ c रेडियोएक्टिभ जुइ व हाफ लाइफ करिब ५७३०या गतिइ ध्वगिनावनि decay)। कार्बोन मनुतेसम् प्राचीनकाल निसें स्युगु म्हो तत्त्वय् छगू ख। कार्बोन धाःगु नां लातिन भाषाया कार्बो धाःगु खँग्वलं वःगु ख। लातिन भाषाय् कार्बोया अर्थ ह्येंग्वा ख। लातिन भाषानाप स्वापू तैगु रोमान्स व स्लाभिक परिवारया भाषाय् कार्बोन धाःगु खँग्वः तत्त्व व ह्येंग्वा निगु हे या निंतिं छ्येलि।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: जिन्क धागु छगु रसायनिक तत्त्व ख। थुकिगु चिं zn ख व एटोमिक ल्याखं ३० ख।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: :'see also zinc is the 23rd most abundant element in the earth's crust
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the most heavily mined ores sphalerite tend to contain roughly 10% iron as well as 40 50% zinc
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: minerals from which zinc is extracted include sphalerite zinc sulfide smithsonite zinc carbonate hemimorphite zinc silicate and franklinite a zinc spinel
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the earth has been estimated to have 46 years supply of zinc
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: there are zinc mines throughout the world with the largest producers being china australia and peru
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 2005 china produced almost one fourth of the global zinc output reports the british geological survey
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: mines and refineries in europe include umicore in belgium tara galmoy and lisheen in ireland and zinkgruvan in sweden
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: zinc metal is produced using extractive metallurgy
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: zinc sulfide sphalerite minerals are concentrated using the froth flotation method and then usually roasted using pyrometallurgy to oxidise the zinc sulfide to zinc oxide
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the zinc oxide is leached in several stages of increasingly stronger sulfuric acid h 2 so 4 ).
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: iron is usually rejected as jarosite or goethite removing other impurities at the same time
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the final purification uses zinc dust to remove copper cadmium and cobalt
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the metal is then extracted from the solution by electrowinning as cathodic deposits
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: zinc cathodes can be directly cast or alloyed with aluminium
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: electrolyte solutions must be very pure for electrowinning to be at all efficient
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: impurities can change the decomposition voltage enough to where the electrolysis cell produces largely hydrogen gas rather than zinc metal
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: there are two common processes for electrowinning the metal the low current density process and the tainton high current density process
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the former uses a 10% sulfuric acid solution as the electolyte with current density of 270 325 amperes per square meter
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the latter uses 22-28% sulfuric acid solution as the electrolyte with current density of about 1000 amperes per square meter
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the latter gives better purity and has higher production capacity per volume of electrolyte but has the disadvantage of running hotter and being more corrosive to the vessel in which it is done
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in either of the electrolytic processes each metric ton of zinc production expends about 3900 kw·h 14 mj of electric power
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: there are also several pyrometallurgical processes that reduce zinc oxide using carbon then distill the metallic zinc from the resulting mix in an atmosphere of carbon monoxide
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these include the belgian type horizontal retort process the new jersey zinc continuous vertical retort process and the st joseph lead company's electrothermal process
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the belgian process requires redistillation to remove impurities of lead cadmium iron copper and arsenic
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the new jersey process employs a fractionating column which is absent in the belgian process that separates the individual impurities where they can be sold as byproducts
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the st joseph lead company process heats the zinc oxide coke mixture by passing an electric current through it rather than by coal or gas fire
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: another pyrometallurgical process is flash smelting
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: then zinc oxide is obtained usually producing zinc of lesser quality than the hydrometallurgical process
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: zinc oxide treatment has much fewer applications but high grade deposits have been successful in producing zinc from zinc oxides and zinc carbonates using hydrometallurgy
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the most widely used alloy of zinc is brass in which copper is alloyed with anywhere from 9% to 45% zinc depending upon the type of brass along with much smaller amounts of lead and tin
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: alloys of 85 88% zinc 4 10% copper and 2 8% aluminum find limited use in certain types of machine bearings
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: alloys of primarily zinc with small amounts of copper aluminum and magnesium are useful in die casting
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: similar alloys with the addition of a small amount of lead can be cold rolled into sheets
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: an alloy of 96% zinc and 4% aluminum is used to make stamping dies for low production run applications where ferrous metal dies would be too expensive
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: :'see also zinc oxide is perhaps the best known and most widely used zinc compound as it makes a good base for white pigments in paint
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it also finds industrial use in the rubber industry and is sold as opaque sunscreen
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a variety of other zinc compounds find use industrially such as zinc chloride in deodorants zinc pyrithione anti-dandruff shampoos zinc sulfide in luminescent paints and zinc methyl or zinc diethyl in the organic laboratory
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: roughly one quarter of all zinc output is consumed in the form of zinc compounds
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: naturally occurring zinc is composed of the 5 stable isotopes 64 zn 66 zn 67 zn 68 zn and 70 zn with 64 zn being the most abundant 48.6% natural abundance
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: twenty one radioisotopes have been characterised with the most abundant and stable being 65 zn with a half life of 244.26 days and 72 zn with a half life of 46.5 hours
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: all of the remaining radioactive isotopes have half lives that are less than 14 hours and the majority of these have half lives that are less than 1 second
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this element also has 4 meta states
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: zinc has been proposed as a salting material for nuclear weapons cobalt is another better known salting material
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a jacket of isotopically enriched 64 zn irradiated by the intense high energy neutron flux from an exploding thermonuclear weapon would transmute into the radioactive isotope zn 65 with a half life of 244 days and produce approximately 2.27 mev of gamma radiation significantly increasing the radioactivity of the weapon's fallout for several days
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: such a weapon is not known to have ever been built tested or used
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: metallic zinc is not considered to be toxic but free zinc ions in solution like copper or iron ions are highly toxic
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: there is also a condition called zinc shakes or zinc chills see metal fume fever that can be induced by the inhalation of freshly formed zinc oxide formed during the welding of galvanized materials
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: excessive intake of zinc can promote deficiency in other dietary minerals
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: पुचः:dietary minerals
lines.name: Newar
